</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Review of license; books, records and reports.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Applicants to whom a license is issued pursuant to this chapter shall provide periodic information demonstrating compliance with the conditions of any license, such as, but not limited to, the continuing requirement that a minimum percentage of the applicant's business income is earned from the sale of food. This documentation shall be provided on a schedule to be coordinated with the applicant's quarterly regulatory fee filings. The city shall provide the form schedule to the licensee. The licensee's acceptance of a license to manufacture or traffic in alcoholic beverages shall constitute consent to the filing of the quarterly report. In the case of caterer filing, the quarterly report shall identify each catered event by type of event, date and address of the event, and shall provide a per event breakdown of sales and the ratio of food sales to alcohol sales during the reporting period. This requirement for filing of reports notwithstanding, the city may at any time come upon the premises of any licensee and examine the books and records to determine whether the licensee is in compliance with all parts of this chapter. In the event the conditions of any license requirement are not met during any particular quarter, the City ABC Administrator shall have discretion in determining whether revocation is appropriate or whether the licensee may be allowed a reasonable period of time to reach compliance. If a good faith effort is demonstrated by the licensee, the City ABC Administrator may apply an accounting period of at least one (1) year in determining whether or not the food sale percentage requirement has been met.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Every licensee under this Ordinance shall keep and maintain, upon the licensed premises, adequate books and records of all transactions involved in the sale of alcoholic beverages in the same manner required by the rules and regulations of the ABC Board. Such books and records shall be available at all reasonable times for inspection by the City ABC Administrator and such city employees who may assist the City ABC Administrator in his or her review.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>For the purpose of assisting the City ABC Administrator in enforcement of this Ordinance, every licensee required to report to the ABC Board under <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall provide a copy of such report to the City ABC Administrator. Copies of any and all reports and correspondences to the ABC Board required by statute shall be furnished to the City ABC Administrator.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Dormancy.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>It is necessary that a licensee actually conduct the business authorized by such a license or else the license will be declared dormant and become null and void after ninety (90) days. Such is the intent of this section. Realizing that a licensee, like other business, may have his or her business interrupted by situations not under his or her control, various exceptions to the dormancy rule have been included in this section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Any license under which no business is transacted during a period of ninety (90) days shall be deemed inactive and, unless the conditions set forth in division (c) below are proved to the satisfaction of the City ABC Administrator, the license shall be surrendered to the City ABC Administrator. If the license is not voluntarily surrendered, it shall be revoked by the City ABC Administrator.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The provisions of division (b) hereof shall not apply to any licensee who is unable to continue in business at the premises for which a license is issued due to construction, an act of God, casualty, death, the acquisition of the premises by any federal, state, city or other governmental agency under power of eminent domain, whether acquisition is voluntary or involuntary, or loss of lease through failure of landlord to renew existing lease. Prior to the expiration of ninety (90) days of inactivity, such licensee shall furnish to the City ABC Administrator a verified statement setting forth the fact that the licensee is unable to continue in business, for any of the specific reasons set forth herein, and the City ABC Administrator may grant an extension of the dormancy with the license continuing to remain in effect during the license period or until same is transferred to another premises, notwithstanding the fact that no business is transacted during said period; provided, however, no such license shall be considered valid unless business is conducted there under within twelve (12) months from the date of notice to the City ABC Administrator. Such extension may not extend beyond the renewal date but may be for such times as the City ABC Administrator deems appropriate in exercise of his or her sound discretion.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>V</designator>
<name>HOURS FOR SALE AND DELIVERY</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Hours for sale and delivery.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>A licensee for distilled spirits, wine and/or malt beverages shall be permitted to sell or dispense distilled spirits, wine and/or malt beverages between the hours of 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 a.m. (midnight) Monday-Saturday. Said licensee shall not be permitted to sell or dispense distilled spirits, wine and/or malt beverages after the hours of 12:00 a.m. (midnight on Saturday) to 12:00 a.m. (midnight on Sunday) with the noted exceptions below:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>A licensee whose premise(s) is considered a “restaurant” under <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, and all other applicable law, and is licensed to serve alcoholic beverages as such by the drink, shall be permitted to sell or dispense distilled spirits, wine and/or malt beverages between the hours of 11:00 a.m. on Sunday until 12:00 a.m. (midnight) on Sunday.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>A licensee for distilled spirits, wine and/or malt beverages by the drink, regardless of whether they meet the “restaurant” requirements as referred to above, shall be permitted to sell or dispense alcoholic beverages on New Year's Eve until 2:00 a.m. on January 1, regardless of the day of the week January 1 shall fall upon, provided that the appropriate licenses and approvals have been obtained from both the City and the state ABC Board.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Retail package distilled spirits, wine sales, and package malt beverage sales shall be permitted from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 a.m. (midnight) each day of the week.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No licensee of any kind shall sell or dispense any distilled spirits or wine during the hours that polls are open on any primary or general election day. Note: Please see state regulations regarding the sale of malt beverages on said days.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>VI</designator>
<name>CONDITIONS, PROHIBITIONS AND RESTRICTIONS</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Gambling.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No gambling or game of chance unless otherwise authorized by the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall be permitted in any form on such licensed premises. Dice, slot machines, or any device of chance is prohibited and shall not be kept on such premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Radio receiving apparatus.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>It shall be unlawful for any licensee licensed under this Ordinance to have, or maintain, any radio receiving apparatus on such premises which is intentionally adjusted so as to receive police messages broadcast from any law enforcement agency in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> as it is now, or may hereafter be operated. In addition to other penalties provided for the violation of this section, the Chief of Police or the City ABC Administrator, or his or her designated investigator, shall have the authority to confiscate any and all such radio receiving apparatus.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Security.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The licensee shall be responsible for maintaining security on his or her premises including providing adequate outside lighting to permit customers to utilize the parking area and to promote the safety, health and welfare of the general public utilizing the licensed premise. Security standards are further necessary to discourage unlawful activity in and around the licensed premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Prizes prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>It shall be unlawful for the licensee under this Ordinance who sells alcoholic beverages of any kind to give away or offer to give away anything tangible of value as a premium or prize, or for any other purpose in direct connection with the sale of alcoholic beverages nor shall any licensee give away any alcoholic beverage in any quantity for less than a full monetary consideration.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Drunkenness.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No licensee or agent or employee of the licensee shall permit any person to become drunk or intoxicated on the premises, nor shall any licensee sell alcoholic beverages to any person who is actually or apparently under the influence of alcoholic beverages, or known to the seller or server to be an habitual drunkard or any person known to the seller or server to have been convicted of drunkenness as many as three (3) times within the most recent twelve (12) month period. No licensee shall permit any person who is actually or apparently under the influence of alcoholic beverages to remain on the licensed premises. As used herein, whether a person is actually or apparently under the influence of alcoholic beverages shall be determined by the licensee or server with specific reference to the principles and guidelines established in mandatory alcohol server training as to the signs of alcohol intoxication.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Underage sales.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The licensee shall not sell or dispense alcoholic beverages to any person who is under 21 years of age. The licensee shall check all photo ID's to ascertain that every person attempting to purchase or consume alcoholic beverages is at least 21 years of age.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Sign requirements &mdash; Notice to persons under the age of twenty-one (21).</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Per state law, the licensee shall display at all times in a prominent place a sign at least 8&Prime; &times;× 11&Prime; in thirty (30) point or larger type font which states as follows:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Persons under the age of twenty-one (21) are subject to a fine of up to $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> if they:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Enter licensed premises to buy, or have served to them, alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Possess, purchase or attempt to purchase, or get another to purchase alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Misrepresent their age for the purpose of purchasing or obtaining alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>License to be displayed.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Pursuant to the requirements set forth in <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, the Licensee, before commencing any business for which a license has been issued, shall post and display at all times in a conspicuous place in the room or principal room where the business is carried on so that all persons visiting the place may readily see the license. The licensee shall not at any time post the license on premises other than the licensed premises or upon premises where traffic in alcoholic beverages is being carried on by any person other than the licensee, or knowingly deface, destroy or alter the license in any respect.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The licensee shall post in a prominent place easily seen by patrons a printed sign at least 11&Prime; &times;× 14&Prime; in size, with letters at least one (1) inch high, supplied by the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commission, and with gender-neutral language supplied by the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Cabinet for Health and Family Services, which shall warn that drinking alcoholic beverages prior to conception or during pregnancy can cause birth defects. A person who violates this section shall be subject to a fine of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fine__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Legal transactions for wholesalers, distributors and retail.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No wholesaler or distributor shall sell any alcoholic beverages to any person in the city for any consideration except under the usual credit or cash terms of the wholesaler or distributor at or before the time of delivery. Nor shall any retail licensee sell to a purchaser for any consideration except for cash at time of purchase.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Employment restrictions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No licensee shall knowingly employ in connection with his or her business any person who:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Has been convicted of any felony within the last two (2) years;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Has been twice convicted of any misdemeanor or offense directly or indirectly attributable to the use of intoxicating liquors within the last two (2) years;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Is under the age of twenty (20) years who will be serving alcoholic beverages or who will be having any contact whatsoever with the sale of alcohol as defined under state statute, unless said person is exempt or permitted under certain circumstances as set forth in KRS and/or the state and local ABC Regulations; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Within two (2) years prior to the date of his or her employment, has had any city license under this chapter revoked for cause.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Happy hour restrictions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Licensees shall not offer reduced drink specials (e.g. two-for-one, happy hours) before 4:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday, nor after the hour of 8:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Lavatory facilities required.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>All retail beer and retail drink licenses shall be required to provide indoor or outdoor lavatory facilities for their customers where such beverages are consumed on the premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Nudity and adult entertainment activities prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No licensee shall offer or permit nudity, adult entertainment activities, including nude or nearly nude dancing, adult motion picture, television, slide or stage shows, cabarets or sexual entertainment centers on any licensed premise. No licensee shall permit explicit sexual activity, whether actual or simulated, upon any licensed premises. No licensee shall sponsor or permit wet t-shirt or wet clothing contests, lingerie fashion shows, mud wrestling, jello wrestling or similar activities, nor shall a licensee allow dancing with touching for compensation (including but not limited to wages, tips, or gratuities), or any other service, display or contest requiring physical contact between patrons and/or patrons and employees on any licensed premises. No licensee shall sponsor, offer or permit drinking contests, all-you-can-drink specials or free drinks on any licensed premise in the city. Note: Also see the City's “Licensing and Regulation of Sexually Oriented Businesses and Employees.”</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Drive-through outlets prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No license shall be issued for any premises to operate a vehicle “drive-through” outlet for the sale of alcoholic beverages, nor shall any person or licensee operate or permit such a vehicle drive-through outlet. This prohibition shall not apply to a “drive-up” window at any premises licensed for retail package liquor, wine or malt beverage, including retail beer, where the primary sales area is arranged for and utilized by persons entering the premises on foot and manually carrying out the products purchased therein.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Cause for revocation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Violation of this Article shall subject the licensee to penalties provided in this Ordinance and shall be cause for revocation of license.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>VII</designator>
<name>MINORS</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Possession by minors prohibited; no person shall aid possession by minors.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Except as specifically authorized under <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, no person under the age of 21 may possess alcoholic beverages or enter onto any licensed premises for the purpose of acquiring alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>As provided in <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, no person under the age of 21, except in the company of a parent or guardian, may enter any premises licensed for the package sale of alcoholic beverages. For purposes of this prohibition, “premises” specifically encompasses the entire lot upon which a licensed establishment is situated, including any drive-up window. The prohibition contained in this division (b) shall not apply to premises where the usual and customary business of the establishment is a gas station, convenience store, grocery store, drugstore, or similar establishment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No person shall knowingly permit, aid, assist, induce, cause or otherwise encourage any minor to be in possession of, use or consume alcoholic beverages. All licensees, as set out in this Ordinance, shall require proof of age of all persons attempting to purchase or consume alcoholic beverages on the licensee's premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No person being the owner or occupant or otherwise in possession or control of any property located within the city shall knowingly allow any minor to remain on such property while in possession of, using or consuming alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>It shall be a defense to any prosecution under this section if the person charged, upon discovery of said minor individuals, manifests a proper effort to enlist the aid of and cooperate with law enforcement personnel in stopping the minor individuals' possession, consumption or use of alcoholic beverages, or that the minor individuals' possession of alcoholic beverages was exempted by <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>VIII</designator>
<name>CONSUMPTION ON PREMISES PROHIBITED</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Consumption on licensed package premised prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No licensee of a package store, whether trafficking in distilled spirits, wine or malt beverages, shall permit consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises. The licensee shall post a prominent notice on the premises stating that consumption of alcoholic beverages on premises is prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Exceptions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>This restriction regarding on premise consumption shall not prohibit sampling as allowed for microbreweries and wineries under the provisions of <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, or where sampling is permitted for a retail distilled spirits and wine licensee under the provisions of <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, or beer tastings as permitted in <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Habitual congregating.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Licensed premises. No person or entity operating a package liquor store, whether trafficking in distilled spirits, wine or malt beverages, including retail package beer licensees, shall knowingly allow or permit habitual congregating of persons on the unenclosed portion of the licensed premises so as to constitute a public nuisance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Vacant property. No person or entity being the owner or otherwise in possession or control of any vacant property shall knowingly allow or permit habitual congregating of persons on the unenclosed portion of such property so as to constitute a public nuisance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>It shall be a defense to any prosecution under Article VIII, if a licensed vendor or property owner shall permit the City to post and maintain a legible, painted or printed sign in at least two (2) separate prominent places in such area, in letters of not less than three (3) inches in height, stating that congregating of persons is prohibited and that violators shall be prosecuted for trespass pursuant to <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Definitions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>In addition to the definitions contained in <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, as used in this Article, the term:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Habitual shall mean consistent, that is, by frequent practice or use, but not necessarily constant or exclusive;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Package liquor store shall mean a retail establishment selling distilled spirits, wine and malt beverages in package containers pursuant to licenses issued for those purposes;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Public nuisance shall mean any activity that endangers or interferes with the general use and enjoyment of neighboring property, passers-by or the health, safety and welfare of the public; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Vacant property shall mean a vacant lot on which no building or other structure exists or property on which any structure is unoccupied or unused, or which otherwise reflects abandonment by the owner or person with the right of occupancy.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>IX</designator>
<name>MALT BEVERAGE KEG REGISTRATION</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Definitions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>As used in this section, “keg” is defined as a container designed and capable of holding six (6) or more gallons of malt beverage.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Malt beverage keg identification tag.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>All retail licensees (herein after referred to as “licensee”) operating within the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> who sell malt beverages in kegs for consumption off the premises of the licensee shall attach a numbered identification tag or other device as provided by the city to each keg at the time of sale and shall require the purchaser to complete and sign a keg registration form for the keg stating the following:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The purchaser is of legal age to purchase, possess and use the malt beverage;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The purchaser is not purchasing the keg for resale and will not allow any person under the age of twenty-one (21) to consume the malt beverage;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The purchaser will not remove, obliterate or allow to be removed or obliterated the identification tag;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The purchaser will state the property address where the keg will be consumed and physically located; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The purchaser is aware of his/her duty to maintain a copy of the keg registration form visible and readily accessible from the location of the keg.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Keg registration.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The licensee shall obtain the name, address and telephone number of the purchaser and shall require the purchaser to produce a valid driver's license number and, if that is not available, to produce at least one other valid form of identification.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The licensee shall retain copies of the keg registration forms for a period of one year and shall make the keg registration form available for inspection by state and local alcoholic beverage control officers and other enforcement officers.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The keg registration form shall be forwarded to the city within five (5) working days in all situations when the keg is not returned or is returned with the identification tag removed or obliterated.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The city is authorized to develop appropriate rules and regulations and to develop and make available forms for the identification tags and keg registration forms.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>All licensees that sell or offer for sale kegs shall post on the licensed premises a notice provided by the city concerning the provisions of this section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Unlawful sales.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>It shall be unlawful for any licensee to sell or offer for sale kegs without the identification tags attached and the keg registration form completed. It shall also be unlawful for any person to remove or to obliterate the identification tag or to fail to have the declaration form visible and readily accessible from the location of the keg. The penalties for violation of this section shall be the penalties as set out in this Ordinance. In addition, licensees violating this section shall be subject to appropriate alcoholic beverage control administrative remedies.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>X</designator>
<name>ENFORCEMENT</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Enforcement.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>City police officers and the City ABC Administrator and Investigator(s) are hereby authorized to enforce this Ordinance in full for alleged violations.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>XI</designator>
<name>PENALTIES</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Penalties.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>In addition to any criminal prosecution instituted in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> District Court against an alleged violator, the City ABC Administrator may assess the fines and penalties authorized in <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, including the per diem assessments for ongoing violations. Should the fines or penalties assessed by the state change under <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>, then the fines or penalties under this article shall be adjusted accordingly to mirror the fines or penalties imposed by state law. Payment of all fines shall be remitted to the City ABC Administrator, who shall then transmit the fines to the City Clerk for deposit in the appropriate designated account.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Any person, firm or corporation who violates any of the provisions of this chapter, for which no other penalty is hereby provided, shall be guilty of a Misdemeanor, and subject to prosecution in the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Court System, as follows: for the first offense, be fined not less than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of minimum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> nor more than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of maximum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr>, or imprisoned for not more than six (6) months, or both; and for the second and each subsequent violation, he or she shall be fined not less than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of minimum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> nor more than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of maximum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr>, or imprisoned for not more than six months, or both. The penalties provided for in this subsection shall be in addition to the revocation or suspension of the offender's license. If the offender is a corporation, LLC, joint stock company, association or other business organization, or a fiduciary, the principal officer or officers responsible for the violation may be imprisoned.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>XII</designator>
<name>MANDATORY RESPONSIBLE BEVERAGE SERVICE TRAINING</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Mandatory responsible beverage service training.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>All persons employed in the selling and serving of alcoholic beverages shall participate in and complete a City ABC Administrator approved “responsible beverage service training program,” which includes, but it not limited to, programs provided by, or recommended by, the state ABC Office (i.e. STARS; TIPS).</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>All persons required to complete training under division (a) above shall complete that training within thirty (30) days of the date on which the person first becomes subject to the training requirement. When a new business is licensed to serve alcoholic beverages all employees must be trained prior to the opening of the business.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Each licensee shall be responsible for compliance with the training requirements and shall maintain for inspection by the City ABC Administrator a record or file on each employee that shall contain the pertinent training information. Each premise licensed hereunder must at all times when alcoholic beverages are being served have at least one person currently certified in responsible beverage service training on duty as described herein.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>All persons completing the training required by this section shall be recertified not less than once every three (3) years thereafter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>XIII</designator>
<name>SIGNS AND ADVERTISING.</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Signs and advertising.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>All signage shall be in compliance with any and all other existing rules, regulations, and Ordinances of the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>, including but not limited to, the Planning and Zoning Ordinance as currently enacted, and/or as may be amended in the future.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No flashing lights shall be used to illuminate the exterior of any premises licensed under this Ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Any advertising by any licensee under this chapter shall be in compliance with <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr> and regulations promulgated thereunder.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No licensee shall publish or display advertising that is false or misleading, nor shall any licensee publish or display advertising that implies that consumption of alcoholic beverages is fashionable or the accepted course of behavior, or advertising that contains any statement, picture or illustration implying that the consumption of alcoholic beverages enhances athletic prowess, whether or not any known athlete is depicted or referred to, nor shall any licensee publish or display advertising that encourages intoxication by referring to the intoxicating effects of alcohol (or the use of terms such as “high test,” “high proof” or “extra strong”) or depicting activities that tend to encourage excessive consumption.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>XIV</designator>
<name>PATIO AND OUTDOOR SALES</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Patio and outdoor sales regulations.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Patio and outdoor sales of alcoholic beverages shall be permitted only on premises licensed for sales of alcoholic beverages by the drink.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No licensee shall offer alcoholic beverages for sale in a patio or outdoor area of the licensee's premises except in a clearly defined patio or outdoor area that is enclosed by a fence or other screening, not less than four (4) feet in height. All outdoor areas and screening shall be subject to the approval of the City ABC Administrator. An exception to this restriction may be granted for seasonal sidewalk cafes, upon application to and authorization from the ABC City Administrator. The permission to operate a sidewalk caf&eacute;é shall be governed by the provisions of this article and shall be subject to the regulation of local zoning authorities as well as codes enforcement and public safety officers.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No licensee shall offer patio or outdoor sales of alcoholic beverages unless the patio or outdoor area and fencing or screening area shall have been approved in advance by the ABC Administrator.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Unless exempted by the following provisions of this Ordinance, and by permission of the City ABC Administrator, patio areas must comply with the screening requirements of this Ordinance. Sidewalk caf&eacute;é seating areas must comply with this Ordinance and with local zoning laws and other public safety requirements noted in this Ordinance, or in other local ordinances, statutes or regulations.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Exception to screening requirement for outdoor sales and service of alcoholic beverages, specifically, permitted sidewalk cafes in the City's downtown business area.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Licensees in the downtown business district/area may request an exception from the outdoor screening of patio provision in order to permit seasonal sidewalk cafes that serve food and alcoholic beverages as an adjunct to the primary and adjacent licensed premises. In the case of permitted sidewalk cafes, they shall be deemed part of the licensed premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Any food establishment which operates a restaurant and is licensed under this Ordinance and the provisions of the state ABC code, may, upon application to the local ABC administrator, ask permission to expand the operation of that restaurant onto a part, and only that part, of the public sidewalk which immediately adjoins the licensed premises (hereinafter referred to as “sidewalk caf&eacute;é”). Licensees who do not serve food shall not be eligible to apply for a sidewalk caf&eacute;é permit.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Conditions for sidewalk caf&eacute;é permit.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The issuance of a permit shall be subject to the following conditions and restrictions; provided, however, that the ABC Administrator may without adverse hearing procedures impose additional reasonable restrictions or withdraw approval upon the operation of any sidewalk caf&eacute;é where necessary in the judgment of the said Administrator to protect the public health, safety or welfare or to prevent a nuisance from developing or continuing:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No sidewalk caf&eacute;é shall be permitted in any portion of the public sidewalk where normal pedestrian traffic flow is obstructed. A minimum clearance width of thirty-six (36) inches must be maintained on the public sidewalk at all times. The sidewalk caf&eacute;é shall not be permitted in any manner to obstruct the entrance/exit to the restaurant.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No tables, chairs or any other furnishings, except plant tubs, shall be placed in the area used for the sidewalk caf&eacute;é during any period when the sidewalk caf&eacute;é is not open and being operated. They shall be removed at the end of each business day at the hour specified in the permit. Umbrellas, tables, chairs, and other portable appurtenances shall be confined to the area shown on the approved Permit. While such caf&eacute;é is in operation, all tables and chairs shall be kept in a clean, sanitary condition.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The use of a portion of the public sidewalk as a sidewalk caf&eacute;é shall not be an exclusive use. All public improvements, including but not limited to, trees, light poles, traffic signals, pull boxes or manholes, or any public-initiated maintenance procedures, shall take precedence over said use of the public sidewalk at all times.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The licensee shall, in addition to all other requirements of law, take reasonable steps to insure that alcoholic beverages are consumed only by patrons of the establishment who are of age, and not by passersby or persons who are not of age or who are obviously or apparently intoxicated.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No disposable cups or drinking vessels may be used and the licensee shall not permit any alcoholic beverages to be taken off premises by patrons, customers or guests.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No amplified sound shall be used within a sidewalk caf&eacute;é. At no time shall any music originating from any part of the premises create a nuisance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(g)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Dancing shall not be permitted or allowed in the sidewalk caf&eacute;é.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(h)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The licensee must at all times comply with all federal, state and local laws regarding the sale, service and consumption of alcohol and the operation of the premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(i)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>The permit for sidewalk caf&eacute;é may not be assigned or transferred.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>Other requirements applicable to sidewalk cafes.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|1|40:1">
<form.text>No sidewalk caf&eacute;é permit shall be effective unless the licensee has filed with the ABC Administrator evidence of insurance, insuring the licensee against liability imposed by law arising out of the ownership, maintenance or operation of such sidewalk caf&eacute;é, in an amount to be established by the City Attorney and the City's Safety Coordinator. The city shall be named an additional insured in the policy required. Such insurance policy shall further provide expressly that it may not be canceled except upon ten (10) day's written notice (or more) filed with the ABC Administrator and the City Attorney.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:3.50</designator>
<name>Liquor license, retail requirement</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NUP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I42ad2e40b52411ee8284e2ab46a0cde5">
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|4|40:3.50">
<form.text>No person shall sell at retail any alcoholic liquor in unincorporated <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> without first having obtained a County retailer's liquor license for each premise where the retailer is located to sell the same. Any violation of a provision in this article shall be punishable by a fine of not less than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of sum__rsqb__</inline.instr> or more than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of sum__rsqb__</inline.instr>. A separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues. Proceedings for administrative adjudication of alleged violations of this Section shall be conducted pursuant to the procedures set out in <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of code__rsqb__</inline.instr>, of the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Code of Ordinances.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|4|40:3.50">
<form.text>The annual fee for a retailer's liquor license is hereby established and the fee for this license is set out in <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of code__rsqb__</inline.instr>. However, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, for the 2021-2022 licensing year, the application fee for a license will be $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of sum__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|4|40:3.50">
<form.text>Every license shall be valid for a period of one year from May 1 to the following April 30. Except as herein otherwise provided, every license shall be subject to the provisions of the Liquor Control Act of 1934 <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of code__rsqb__</inline.instr> and shall be subject to all laws, resolutions and regulations now in force and effect or which may hereinafter be enacted, adopted, or approved relating to alcoholic liquor.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|4|40:3.50">
<form.text>No person shall sell at retail any alcoholic liquor in unincorporated <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> in violation of any part or portion of the Liquor Control Act or the provisions of this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|4|40:3.50">
<form.text>No liquor shall be sold, offered for sale, kept for sale, displayed or advertised for sale at retail or delivered to any person purchasing same at retail, within unincorporated <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> except at a location, place, or premises described in a retailer's liquor license.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|4|40:3.50">
<form.text>Where two or more locations, places or premises are under the same roof or at one street address, a separate license shall be obtained for each such location, place or premises, unless all the rooms which the licensee uses for the retail sale of alcoholic liquor are directly connected, adjacent and contiguous with and to each other. Each license shall define with certainty the room or rooms in which liquor is to be sold. No person licensed to sell liquor under a license, shall sell, give away or otherwise dispose of alcoholic liquor at any place other than the place specifically described in their license, whether such place be in the same building or not; provided that nothing herein contained shall be so construed as to prevent any hotel operator licensed under the provisions of this article from serving alcoholic liquor to such person's registered guests in any room or part of such person's hotel, if such liquor so served shall be kept in and served from a licensed location, place or premises in the hotel as specified in the license. The foregoing provision shall apply only to hotels conducted and maintained as such.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(g)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|4|40:3.50">
<form.text>A license for every location, place or premises licensed under the terms and by virtue of the above provisions shall be framed and hung in plain view in a conspicuous place on the premises so licensed.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(h)</designator>
</name.block>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</para>
</form>
</section.body>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:3.60</designator>
<name>Liquor license application process, notice</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NUP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I42ada370b52411ee8284e2ab46a0cde5">
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|5|40:3.60">
<form.text>When an application for a retailer's liquor license is received by the Liquor Control Commissioner, the Liquor Control Commissioner shall cause to be published a notice that application has been made for such license in a daily newspaper of general circulation, not devoted to any particular profession, trade or class of business in the County, and a similar notice in the local newspaper published nearest to the premises sought to be licensed. The published notice shall state the name of the applicant, the resident address of the applicant, and the street number and location of the premises covered by the application, and notify all persons that any objections to the granting of the license shall be made to the Liquor Control Commissioner, in writing, signed by the objector, within ten days, and stating specifically the grounds of their objection. The cost of publication of the notices shall be paid by the applicant to the Liquor Control Commissioner shall be set out in Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__designation of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>, in addition to the license fee required at the time of the filing of the application for a license. No license shall be issued until 15 days after the first publication of the notice has elapsed. No publication shall be necessary for the renewal of any license that has been issued after the original publication.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|5|40:3.60">
<form.text>Each applicant shall submit his or her fingerprints to the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Sheriff's Office in the form and manner prescribed by the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Police. These fingerprints shall be forwarded by the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Sheriff's Office to the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Police and checked against the fingerprint records now and hereafter filed in the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Police and Federal Bureau of Investigation criminal history records databases. In the event that criminal history information is recovered by the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Police, the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Sheriff shall forward to the Liquor Control Commissioner all information received from the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Police relating to the criminal history of the applicants.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|5|40:3.60">
<form.text>The applicant shall request the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Building and Zoning and the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Public Health to inspect the premises sought to be licensed to determine whether those premises conform to the relevant county building, zoning and public health ordinances. No license shall be issued until the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Building and Zoning reports to the Liquor Control Commissioner that the premises sought to be licensed are in conformity with the relevant building and zoning requirements and the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Public Health reports to the Liquor Control Commissioner that the premises sought to be licensed are in conformity with the relevant public health requirements.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|5|40:3.60">
<form.text>No license shall be issued unless the applicant provides satisfactory documentation of liquor liability insurance (dram shop) coverage for the premises, in the aggregate amount of at least $1,000,000.00.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|5|40:3.60">
<form.text>In the discretion of the Liquor Control Commissioner, any misstatements made by the applicant in the application shall be cause for denial of the application or revocation of any license issued or sought to be issued under this Section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>INTENT.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>State legislation of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> found in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>, provides for remedies and sets forth proper procedures with respect to suspension, revocation, or nonrenewal of licenses. The City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>, by enactment of this ordinance, states that it is the public policy of the City to balance the interest of it's citizens and of visitors to the City against the interest of the license holders in operating and maintaining their business activities upon licensed premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>If the license holder fails to adhere to certain minimum standards, or fails to abide by this ordinance or applicable Law of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>, the license holder shall be subject to the provisions herein set forth.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>To provide for an orderly administration of this ordinance, and the maintenance of existing licenses, it is the policy of the City to provide and adopt rules relative to maintenance of licenses and the suspension, revocation or nonrenewal thereof.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>In order to implement this policy, there shall be an alcohol beverage demerit point system. This demerit point system is designed to enable the City to enforce this ordinance and State Law. A violation, and the accumulation of demerit points, may lead to a forfeiture, suspension, revocation or nonrenewal as set forth herein.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>

</form.para>

</form.para>
</form.item>

<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>PENALTIES FOR ACCUMULATION OF DEMERIT POINTS</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Penalties for the accumulation for demerit points by a licensee within one license year are as follows.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Accumulated points. Penalty</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Twenty-five (25) demerit points: none.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Fifty (50) demerit points: $50 forfeiture.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Seventy-five (75) demerit points: $100 forfeiture.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>One Hundred (100) demerit points: Suspension of not less than three (3) nor more than ninety (90) days, or revocation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>The date of the violation shall determine the accumulation of demerit points within a 12-month period.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>When one year from the date of a given violation expires, the points for that violation are no longer part of the demerit point accumulation. However, the violation may be considered by the Council in its evaluation of any suspension, revocation or nonrenewal matter involving the same licensed premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>

</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">

</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">

</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>NOTIFICATION.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>The license holder shall be notified that:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">

</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>The complaint alleges a specific violation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>The demerit point value of the alleged violation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>He or she may request a fact-finding hearing.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(5)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Waiver of the fact-finding hearing shall constitute an admission of the alleged violation and demerit points will be assessed and the penalty, if any, imposed.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>The City Clerk shall furnish notification to the license holder within 10 days of receiving the sworn written complaint. The notification is to be given in writing and submitted to the license holder by regular mail.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>FACT-FINDING HEARING.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>If a fact-finding hearing is requested:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>The hearing shall be conducted by the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Written notice shall be given no less than five days nor more than 10 days prior to the date scheduled for the hearing.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Notice shall be given by certified mail.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Fact-finding hearing shall be conducted in a manner similar to the procedures set forth in State Statutes found in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>At the conclusion of the fact-finding hearing, the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Make findings of fact and conclusions.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Announce it's decision at a regular or special meeting of the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>The City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> may take the matter before it in a fact-finding hearing under advisement. If findings and conclusions are not announced within ninety (90) days of the date of the fact-finding hearing, the complaint is deemed to be dismissed.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>The Clerk shall notify the license holder of the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>'s decision, in writing, within ten (10) days of the date the decision was announced by the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>If the decision involves a suspension of the license, the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall specify the dates of the suspension, and the notification from the Clerk shall so designate. If the decision involves a revocation, the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall specify the effective date of the revocation and the notification from the Clerk shall so designate.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 7.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>SUSPENSION, REVOCATION OR NONRENEWAL.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|6|40:4">
<form.text>Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr> of the Statutes of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> is hereby adopted by reference and made a part of this ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
