<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:4.50</designator>
<name>Temporary liquor license, pandemic</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NUP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ia8ddb5d06b9a11eb97d3faab06839f22">
<form.para>
<form.text>CLASS COVID TEMPORARY: Authorizing current Liquor License Holders, in good standing, during the COVID Pandemic condition, to sell and offer for retail sale alcoholic beverages, as defined in the Liquor Control Act of 1934, to be sold and consumed on the premises, including the parking lot and area adjacent thereto, where alcoholic beverages are sold. Said License is subject to any and all other restrictions on the property on which the Licensed Premises is located, including those imposed by the property owner, landlord, condominium association or any such other restrictions encumbering the premises. Further, the License Holder must maintain all existing handicapped parking, unless suitable arrangements are made to relocate said handicapped parking to accommodate the outdoor use, said handicapped parking must be in accordance with Americans with Disabilities Guidelines.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|7|40:4.50">
<form.text>
p.fl="none">It is the responsibility of the Licensee to fully comply with all Center for Disease Control (CDC) Recommendations, all <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> Department of Public Health (DPH) Rules and must obtain approval from the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> County Health Department.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|7|40:4.50">
<form.text>
p.fl="none">Further, the License Holder shall segregate, by partition or otherwise, the area utilized for seating and its patrons from any and all vehicular traffic. Any music or other activities on the premises shall be conducted in accordance with the City's current sound regulations and all music must cease by 9:00 p.m.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|7|40:4.50">
<form.text>
p.fl="none">Such Temporary License shall be valid until indoor bar and restaurant service is fully restored in accordance with the Restore <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> Plan and will thereafter terminate without further notice. The City reserves the right to expand, restrict or eliminate the conditions set forth herein in accordance with all Federal, State and Local regulations or mandates. The conditions and restrictions provided for in the current Liquor License, to the extent not otherwise modified herein, remain in full force and effect. Upon the expiration of this COVID Temporary License, the License Holder's operation shall resume under the terms and conditions of their existing Liquor License.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|7|40:4.50">
<form.text>
p.fl="none">The City has determined, in light of the hardship experienced by the business establishments in the City from the COVID-19 Pandemic, to waive the License Fee for the COVID Temporary License. Any current Liquor License Holder, in good standing, is eligible for the COVID Temporary Liquor License, upon submitting an Application to the City.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|7|40:4.50">
<form.text>
p.fl="none">Nothing herein shall prevent the City from otherwise exercising its general police powers to ensure the health, safety and welfare of the residents and City.
</form.text>
</para>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:5</designator>
<name>License list, transfers, unused license, change in location, change in ownership, peddling</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LIC</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I4376d5302f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1 License List</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|8|40:5">
<form.text>The Liquor Control Commissioner shall keep or cause to be kept a complete record/official listing of all licensees and licenses issued by said Liquor Control Commissioner.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|8|40:5">
<form.text>Upon issuance of any license or revocation of any license, the Liquor Control Commissioner shall notify the County Treasurer, State's Attorney and Sheriff within 48 hours by providing a copy of such transactions or an updated copy of the official list of licensees and licenses issued.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2 Transfers</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|8|40:5">
<form.text>Any license granted shall not be subject to attachment, garnishment or execution, nor shall it be alienable to transferable, voluntarily or involuntarily, or subject to being encumbered or the subject matter of any lien. The trustees of any insolvent or bankrupt licensee, when such estate consists, in part, of alcoholic beverages, may continue the business of the sale of alcoholic liquor under order of the appropriate court, and may exercise the privileges of deceased or insolvent or bankrupt licensee after the death of such descendent, or such insolvency or bankruptcy until the expiration of such license, but not longer than six months after the death, bankruptcy or insolvency of such licensee. No license may enter into any lease, rental or employment agreement which, in any manner constitutes a transfer of the license or any aspect thereof. Any license fees paid to <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall not be refunded in the event any such business ceases to operate during the term of the license issued.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3 Unused License</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|8|40:5">
<form.text>Any business which ceases to operate for a period of sixty (60) days during the term of a license for any cause shall be deemed to have an unused license. Any such unused license shall be forfeited and shall be considered null and void for the period that the license is not in use. Any license fees paid to <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall not be refunded when a license is forfeited. Any license holder wishing to renew an unused license shall pay a renewal license fee of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fee__rsqb__</inline.instr> and shall submit a Renewal application; however, the Liquor Control Commissioner can reissue said license for the remainder of the current term of the license without following the review procedures required in <inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of code reference__rsqb__</inline.instr>. In the event that a business is closed as a result of an act of God, the Liquor Control Commissioner may hold open the licensee's license for a period not to exceed one (1) year from the date of occurrence.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4 Change of Location</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|8|40:5">
<form.text>Any license holder who proposes to change the location of the business which is licensed shall notify the Liquor Control Commissioner in writing prior to such change being made. The Liquor Control Commissioner shall notify the Liquor Control Commission and shall update and reissue the official license list required in Section 1 of this Article. In the event that the new location does not meet the requirements of this Ordinance, the applicant will be so notified by the Liquor Control Commissioner.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5 Change in Ownership</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|8|40:5">
<form.text>Any transfer of an operating business between owners or any change in ownership shall cause the new owner to submit an “Application for New License,” and a new license fee in accordance with <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>. Such new application will be handled and acted upon in accordance with <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>; however, the Liquor Control Commissioner shall be required to issue notification to the previous owner and the new owner that the license is being issued to the new owner. Any new owner of an operating business shall not sell alcoholic beverages until such time as a new license has been issued by the Liquor Control Commissioner.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6 Peddling</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|8|40:5">
<form.text>It shall be unlawful for any person, firm, partnership, or corporation to peddle alcoholic liquor within <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> outside the corporate limits of any municipality and accordingly, the sale of alcoholic beverages shall be limited to the premises for which a license is issued under the terms of this Ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
<trace.deleted/>
</form>
</section.body>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:7</designator>
<name>Alcohol awareness program required</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LIC</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I4386dac02f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>ALCOHOL AWARENESS PROGRAM.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>Every business and establishment selling or providing alcoholic beverages for on premise consumption shall create and implement an alcohol awareness program.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>The alcohol awareness program shall, at a minimum, contain the following elements:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>Instruction of every employee who prepares or serves alcoholic beverages on the laws of this City and State regarding the sale, consumption and possession of alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>Provide an ongoing training process to promote continued awareness of alcohol related matters, including the effect alcohol has upon the human body.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>A method to verify age of purchasers and consumers of alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>A prohibition of serving alcoholic beverages to minors.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>A prohibition of serving alcohol beverages to obviously intoxicated persons.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>A method to identify intoxicated persons.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>A prohibition of sales promotions involving serving alcoholic beverages without charge.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>A method to provide disciplinary action against employees who violate the program.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>A method to advise patrons that the establishment has an alcohol awareness program and who to contact for additional information.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>The owner or operator of every business and establishment serving alcoholic beverages shall deliver a copy of its alcohol awareness program to the Chief of Police by January 1 of each calendar year.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|10|40:7">
<form.text>TIME LIMIT. All businesses and establishments now serving alcoholic beverages for on premise consumption shall have 90 days to create a program and file it with the Chief of Police.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>1</designator>
<name></trace></name>
</name.block>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>2</designator>
<name></trace></name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|3|40:3">
<form.text>EVIDENCE OF INTOXICATION. It is recognized that if there is ten-hundredths of one percent or more by weight of alcohol in this person's blood, this shall be prima facie evidence that the person is intoxicated. It is recognized that a correlation has been found to exist between the alcohol concentration in human breath and that in human blood, and it is this relationship which allows an analysis of breath to be used to infer the alcohol concentration in blood.</trace></form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>3</designator>
<name></trace></name>
</name.block>

</name.block>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:8</designator>
<name>Warnings posted for pregnant women</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I438ad2602f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.para>
<form.text>Whereas, the Surgeon General of the United States has advised women who are pregnant, or considering pregnancy, not to drink alcoholic beverages;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>
Whereas, recent research indicates that alcohol consumption during pregnancy, especially in the early months, can harm the fetus, and result in birth defects including mental retardation, facial abnormalities and other defects involving heart and bone structure;
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>
Whereas such kinds of harms are known as Fetal Alcohol Syndrome and Fetal Alcohol Effect;
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>
Whereas, in order to serve the public health, safety, and welfare, the City Council of the City of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, desires to educate the public on these dangers by requiring warning signs to be placed at all locations where alcoholic beverages are sold to the public:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>
Be it ordained by the City Council of the City of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> that the City Code be amended as follows:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>INTRODUCTION. Chapter <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of chapter__rsqb__</inline.instr> of the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> City Code is amended by adding the following article.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>ARTICLE <inline.instr>__lsqb__designation of article__rsqb__</inline.instr>. Warnings posted to pregnant women.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE WARNING SIGNS.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>Any person or entity who owns, operates, manages, leases or rents premises offering wine, beer, or other alcoholic beverage for sale, or dispensing such beverages for consideration to the public, shall cause a sign or notice to be permanently posted or displayed on the premises as provided in this ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>The sign referred to in paragraph (a) above shall read as follows:</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>Each sign or notice required here shall not be smaller than 8.5 inches wide by 5.5 inches long, nor shall the lettering be less than 3/8 inch in height.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>PLACEMENT.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>Where the sale of dispensing of wine, beer, or other alcoholic beverages to the public is primarily intended for consumption off the premises, at least one sign shall be so placed as to assure that it is conspicuously displayed so as to be readable at all points of purchase.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>Where the sale of wine, beer, or other alcoholic beverages to the public is primarily intended for consumption on the premises, at least one sign shall be placed as to assure that it is conspicuously displayed so as to be readable in each public restroom.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>LANGUAGE. In the event a substantial number of the public patronizing any premises offering for sale or dispensing wine, beer, or other alcoholic beverage use a language other than English as a primary language, an additional sign or notice shall be worded in the other language or languages involved.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<form.text>PENALTY. Any person, firm or corporation violating any provision of this article shall be fined not less than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of minimum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> nor more than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of maximum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for each offense, and a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<para.text>
Based, with some changes in wording, on an ordinance furnished courtesy of Charles R. Revlett, City Attorney, Oceanside, California.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|11|40:8">
<para.text>
In general, concerning the power of the municipality to regulate every aspect of the liquor trade, see rc.ref.id="I003AMZ">McQuillin, The Law of Municipal Corporations &dblsect;24:159 et seq. (3d ed.).
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:9</designator>
<name>Keg identification required</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I438ca7202f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|12|40:9">
<form.text>KEG IDENTIFICATION REQUIRED.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|12|40:9">
<form.text>As used in this section, “keg” means any brewery-sealed, individual container of beer having a liquid capacity of seven and three-fourths gallons or more.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|12|40:9">
<form.text>All licensees operating within the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>, State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>, who sell beer in kegs for consumption off licensed premises shall attach a numbered identification tag to each keg of beer at the time of sale and shall require the signing of a receipt by the purchaser, with the identifying number noted on the receipt. The purpose is to enable the keg to be traced if it is used in violation of any state law or city ordinance. The receipts and the keg identification tags shall be in a form approved by the Chief of Police. The receipt shall clearly identify the purchaser in a legible manner, and shall contain the purchaser's address and the location where the beer in the keg is expected to be consumed. The licensee shall keep all receipts for not less than six months.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|12|40:9">
<form.text>Penalty. Any person, firm or corporation violating any provision of this Section shall be fined not less than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of minimum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> nor more than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of maximum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for each offense, and a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues. Repeated or willful violations may be grounds for suspension or revocation of a license to sell alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|12|40:9">
<para.text>
Based, with some changes in wording, on an ordinance furnished courtesy of Lisa A. Botham, City Attorney, Green River, Wyoming.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|12|40:9">
<para.text>
For application form for license to purchase keg of beer see rc.ref.id="I003AN2">Municipal Legal Forms &dblsect;47:1 et seq.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
</note.block>
</form>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:10</designator>
<name>Possession of keg<sep/> Permit required</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LIC</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I439162102f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>DEFINITIONS. For the purpose of this section the following definitions shall apply:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>“Keg” means any brewery-sealed, individual container that contains beer or malt beverage and has a liquid capacity of 73/4 gallons or more.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>PERMIT TO POSSESS KEGS REQUIRED. No person shall possess a keg in a residentially zoned area within the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> without after first having obtained a permit and permit sticker from the Office of the City Clerk.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>PERMIT FEE. The permit fee for each keg shall be $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of permit fee__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>LIMITATIONS. All permits authorized under the preceding section shall be subject to the following limitations:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>The permit is valid for possession of one keg containing up to 16 gallons. No person may possess more than one permit at any one time.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>No more than one keg may be possessed within any dwelling unit, lodging house, fraternity house, or sorority house located in a residentially zoned area within the City. No resident shall possess or allow any other person to possess a keg contrary to this section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>No application shall be approved without the applicant first providing written authorization from the owner of the premises where the applicant will be possessing the keg or the owner's agent on a form provided by the City Clerk.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>APPLICATION FOR PERMIT AND PERMIT STICKER. Any person desiring to obtain a permit to possess a keg shall fill out an application at the Office of the City Clerk setting forth the applicant's full name, address and telephone number and the address within the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> where the applicant will be possessing the keg. In addition, the applicant will be required to provide proof of identity and age in the form of a valid State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> driver's license or other equivalent identification card, birth certificate, or valid driver's license from another jurisdiction. Falsifying any information requested on the permit application shall constitute a violation of this ordinance. At the time of issuance of the permit, a permit sticker shall also be issued to the applicant. The permit sticker shall be immediately and firmly affixed by the applicant to the keg utilizing the adhesive on the sticker and placing the sticker in a clearly visible location.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>A permittee shall have the permit present at the location where the keg is possessed at all times, and shall exhibit the permit upon request of any licensed peace officer.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>DUTY OF LICENSED LIQUOR ESTABLISHMENT. Each licensed liquor establishment located in the City, and offering for sale kegs containing beer or malt liquor in kegs for consumption off premises, shall, as a condition of said license, post in a conspicuous location within five feet of each checkout location in the establishment, a notice provided by the Police Department regarding the provisions of this Ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 7.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>EXCEPTIONS. Any person or premises licensed under any provision of state law or local ordinance to sell or to distribute beer or malt liquor may possess kegs without the permit to possess a keg.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 8.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<form.text>PENALTY. Any person, firm or corporation violating any provision of this ordinance shall be fined not less than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of minimum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> nor more than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of maximum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for each offense, and a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<para.text>
Based, with some changes in wording, on an ordinance furnished courtesy of Paula C. Faust, Paralegal in the office of Jan Petersen, City Attorney for the City of St. Cloud, Minnesota.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|13|40:10">
<para.text>
For application form for license to purchase keg of beer see rc.ref.id="I003AOF">Municipal Legal Forms &dblsect;47:1 et seq.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:10.10</designator>
<name>Keg license</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NUP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I42b03b80b52411ee8284e2ab46a0cde5">
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(p)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Class K licenses (Kegs).</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>For purposes of this sub-section (p), the term “keg” shall mean any packaging or container which is capable of containing alcoholic liquor in excess of sixteen (16) gallons. This sub-section (p) shall apply whether a keg containing alcoholic liquor is sold or rented.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>No licensee, regardless of class of license, shall sell one or more kegs containing alcoholic liquor without first having obtained the signature of an adult purchaser on an adult responsibility form provided by the City. At the time of sale of any keg, the licensee shall verify by proper government-issued identification that the purchaser is twenty-one (21) years of age or older. The licensee shall retain such signed form at the place of sale of such one or more kegs for a period ofno less than six (6) months from the date of sale.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>The licensee shall make available for inspection by the City of any and all signed adult responsibility forms upon the City's request.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>No person shall purchase or attempt to purchase one or more kegs containing alcoholic liquor without having first signed an adult responsibility form approved by the City as provided by the seller of such keg.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(5)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>The adult responsibility form shall, at a minimum, include the following information:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Date of keg sale.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Name of seller.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Name of purchaser.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>d</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Residential address of purchaser.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>e</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Age of purchaser.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>f</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Government issued identification number used to verify purchaser's age (e.g., driver's license nwnber, state identification card, passport, active military identification).</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>g</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Number of kegs sold.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>h</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>A brief description of the contents of each keg sold (e.g., beer, wine, etc.).</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>i</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>Location where the keg will be used to dispense the alcoholic liquor contained therein.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>j</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>The nature, purpose or reason for the event for which the keg is being purchased.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>k</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>The date or dates, as the case may be, when the event will occur at which the keg will be present.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>l</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>The number of persons expected to be present during the event.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>m</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>An acknowledgment that no admission fee, cover-charge, or similar charge will be required to be paid for entry into or participation at the event.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>n</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>An aclmowledgement that the purchaser shall exercise reasonable due diligence to assure that persons under the age of twenty-one (21) years will not be invited to or be allowed to be present or in attendance at the event.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(6)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>No person shall possess or attempt to possess one or more kegs containing alcoholic liquor without first having obtained a Class K license from the City and paying the fee for such license.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(7)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>A Class K license shall permit the holder thereof to purchase and/or possess one or more kegs containing alcoholic liquor, provided, however, that the licensee shall not sell, attempt to sell, or permit any other person to sell or attempt to sell, directly or indirectly by way of admission fee, cover-charge, or other similar charge, the alcoholic liquor contained in the one or more kegs.</form.text>
</form.para>

<name.block>

</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>For purposes of this sub-section (p), any person who is in control of the premises where one or more kegs containing alcoholic liquor are present shall be deemed in control of such premises regardless of whether that person is an owner or a lessee of such premises and whether or not such person is the person who signed the adult responsibility form provided for in this sub-section (p).</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(9)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>A holder of a Class A, AA, B, C, D, HL, and/or T license shall not be required to obtain a signed adult responsibility fonn in connection with that license holder's dispensing or sale of alcoholic liquor from one or more kegs in the ordinary course of such license holder's business of special event.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(10)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|14|40:10.10">
<form.text>A Class K license shall be issued for a single event in duration of no more than two (2) consecutive days and the issuance of a Class K license shall be limited to such single event. However, the issuance of a Class K license shall not be deemed, construed or interpreted as the issuance of a Special Event permit as is or may be required by City Ordinance and/or the City Policy &amp; Procedure Manual. In the event the one or more kegs are intended for use or are used at a special event, the sponsor of such special event shall comply with any ordinance and/or policy and procedure regarding the issuance of Special Event permits and the requirements for obtaining a Special Event permit.</form.text>

<name>Beer gardens</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>

<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I4393ac002f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>PERMIT REQUIRED. No person shall hereafter keep, maintain, conduct or operate any beer garden without first obtaining a permit therefor.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>DEFINITIONS. As used in this ordinance, the following terms shall have the following meanings, unless the context clearly indicates that a different meaning is intended:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>Beer garden. An open, unroofed area where beer and other alcoholic beverages are served or consumed.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>PERMIT FEE, YEAR. The annual fee for a beer garden permit shall be $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fee__rsqb__</inline.instr> and every permit shall terminate on the 30th day of June next following the issuance of the same.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>APPLICATION. Application for a beer garden permit shall be made to the city clerk and may be granted upon approval by the city council. No beer garden shall be permitted within 100 feet of land zoned for residential purposes. The permit shall be posted conspicuously in the beer garden at all times it shall be in use.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>CONDITIONS. No beer garden shall be permitted, maintained, or operated except in conformity with the following regulations:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>The beer garden area shall be particularly described and adjacent to, and operated as a part of, premises licensed to sell beer or malt beverages for consumption on the premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>Beer gardens shall be no greater in area than one-half the other floor space of the licensed premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>Beer gardens shall be limited to one person for each 10 square feet and shall have separately posted the maximum capacity.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>At any part of the beer garden not blocked by a building, there shall be maintained or constructed a hedge or fence not less than three feet high surrounding the beer garden area. The fence shall contain the required fire exit or exits. Each gate or exit shall be not less than three feet high, shall swing to egress, shall be equipped with proper hardware, and shall swing free and clear of public sidewalks. The beer garden fence shall comply with all city ordinances regarding vision clearance and required distances from corners.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>All electrical wiring shall comply with national, state and city electrical codes.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>All combustible rubbish shall be stored in noncombustible covered containers.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(g)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>The noise emanating from any beer garden shall not violate any of the regulations of the City Code of Ordinances pertaining to noise.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(h)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|15|40:11">
<form.text>The fermented malt beverage licensee or his agent shall be responsible for preventing violations of this section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>

When a condominium development is within 1,000 feet of the subject location, the notice need only be sent to the condominium association. The notice shall be sent no sooner than 60 days and no later than 30 days before the filing of the beer garden license application with the Liquor Control Commissioner. </outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>

<section.body>
<form uuid="I4395a7d02f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>Generally.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>The consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises shall be allowed in open areas and outdoor patios as provided in this Section. In all cases, such outdoor patios and open areas shall conform to the following requirements:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>Such outdoor patios or open areas shall be directly adjacent to the pertinent licensed structure;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>Such outdoor patios or open areas shall be in compliance with the Unified Development Code, all applicable building, fire and safety codes, and all other appropriate regulations as to the safe and orderly operation of the establishment, including, but not limited to regulations pertaining to maximum capacity, ingress, and egress; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>The sale or consumption of alcoholic beverages shall be prohibited on sidewalks or parking lots.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>Patios and Open Areas Not Visible from Public Roads.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>A licensee selling alcoholic beverages for consumption on the premises may serve alcoholic beverages to patrons on outdoor patios or open areas; however, if any portion of such patio or open area is visible from any public street, road or highway, then the licensee shall be required to satisfy the fencing and/or railing restrictions described in subsection (c) below.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>Outdoor Patios and Open Areas Visible from Public Roads.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|17|40:12">
<form.text>Where any portion of an outdoor patio or open area is visible from any public street, road or highway, a licensee selling alcoholic beverages for consumption on the premises may serve alcoholic beverages to patrons on an outdoor patio or open area only if such outdoor patio or open area is completely enclosed and attached to the licensed structure by fencing, railing, gating, a wall, or some other physical barrier with a minimum height of three feet and maximum openings of four inches between slats, except for any required emergency exits. In the event there is exists a conflict between the &lsquo;‘maximum opening of four inches between slats&rsquo;’ requirement, and any similar rule or requirement pertaining to &lsquo;‘slat openings&rsquo;’ promulgated by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (“OSHA”), the OSHA rule or regulation shall control.</form.text>
</form.para>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:13</designator>
<name>Bottle clubs (brown bagging)</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I439903302f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 1 PURPOSE</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>The purpose of this ordinance is to protect the public health, safety and welfare of the citizens of the Town of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of town__rsqb__</inline.instr> by regulating the licensing and operations of Bottle Clubs.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 2 LICENSE REQUIRED</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>No person, firm, or corporation shall keep, maintain, operate, lease, or otherwise furnish, either to its members and guests or to the general public, any premises, in the Town of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of town__rsqb__</inline.instr>, for use as a bottle club, without first having obtained a license therefore to be issued by the Town Clerk after approval of the Town Council in accordance with this Article.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>Definitions: Unless otherwise defined herein or in the text, all words used will have their common meaning.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>Bottle Club&mdash;Bottle Club means any establishment or premises which is operated on a regular basis in the following manner:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>no alcoholic beverages sold on the premises;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>all members, guests or members of the public must provide their own alcoholic beverages for consumption on the premises; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>fees or other charges are imposed on all members, guests or members of the public for admission to the premises; or for setups, i.e., liquid mixers, cups, ice and other items associated with the consumption of alcoholic beverages or for any other reason. For purposes of this ordinance, the term bottle club shall include, but not be limited to all such premises designated for municipal regulation under <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>Person&mdash;Person shall mean any individual, person, firm, corporation, association, partnership or organization.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>Officer&mdash;Officer shall mean any officer, director, stockholder, owners, manager, or person who either has a financial interest of any nature in a bottle club or directs any policy of a bottle club.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 3 LICENSE FEE</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>The annual license fee for a bottle club shall be $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fee__rsqb__</inline.instr> payable to the Town of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of town__rsqb__</inline.instr> and deposited with the Town Clerk upon the filing of an application for a license. In the event an application is denied or withdrawn, the license fee shall be refunded to the applicant.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 4 APPLICATION</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>All applications for a bottle club license shall be made in writing to the Municipal Officers and shall state:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>the name of the applicant(s)</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>address of applicant(s)</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>whether applicant is a corporation, association or partnership</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>attested copies of articles of incorporation, association or documents of partnership</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(5)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>copies of bylaws</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(6)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>names and addresses of all principal officers</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(7)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>location and description of premises for which license is desired</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(8)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>whether applicant(s) has had a bottle-club license elsewhere</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(9)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>whether applicant(s) has ever had a license denied or revoked; and,</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(10)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>any additional information that may be required by the municipal officers in the issuing of the license.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 5 INVESTIGATION OF APPLICANT</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>Upon the receipt of an application for a bottle-club license, the municipal officers shall require that:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>the Police Chief investigate the background of the applicant(s);</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>the Fire Chief inspect the location and premises to determine whether the bottle club meets proper fire and safety standards; and,</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>the Health Officer inspect the premises of the bottle club to determine whether premises meet proper Health and Safety Standards. A written report of his findings shall be made to the Council by each officer.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>No license shall be granted for any bottle club if it is found that the premises and buildings to be used do not fully comply with the ordinances and state statutes pertaining to the protection of the Public Health and Safety.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 6 PUBLIC HEARING</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>Prior to the issuance of a license, the municipal officers shall hold a public hearing on any application for a bottle club. Notice of the public hearing shall be given by publication in a newspaper of general circulation in the Town at least once, not more than 30 nor less than seven days before the date set for the Hearing, and, said notice shall set forth the date, time, and place for the hearing at which time the testimony of the applicant(s) and that of any interested citizen shall be taken.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 7 LICENSE NOT TRANSFERRABLE</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>A separate license must be obtained for each bottle club, and each license shall authorize the operation of such an establishment only at the location described in such license and in conformity with all applicable ordinances and state statutes. No license shall be sold or transferred to another person or to any other location. A license issued to a bottle club shall be displayed at all times in a conspicuous place on the premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 8 HOURS OF OPERATIONS</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>The premises used as a bottle club shall be open for business no earlier than 6:00 P.M. nor later than 1:00 A.M. the following morning at which time the club will be closed and vacated by members, guests, or other persons, other than regular employees. During the hours that a bottle club must remain closed, the use thereof by anyone of the premises or facilities of the bottle club for the drinking of alcoholic beverages is prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 9 MINORS PROHIBITED</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>No person under the age of twenty (20) years shall be permitted in any bottle club.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 10 LICENSE EXPIRATION</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>All licenses issued pursuant to this ordinance shall expire one year from the date of issue.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 11 SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>A license to operate a bottle club, as provided for by this ordinance, may be denied, suspended or revoked by the Town Council for either violation of or suspended or failure to comply with any of the provisions of this ordinance, or with the provisions of any other applicable law or ordinance. Determination of the severity of the violation and whether or not a denial, suspension, or revocation is warranted, shall be made by the Town Council, after notice and hearing.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 12 APPEALS</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>An appeal from any final decision of the Town Council shall be taken by any party to the superior court in accordance with the provisions of <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr> of the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Rules of Civil Procedure.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 13 PENALTY</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>In addition to any action which the Town Council may take, violation of any provision of this ordinance shall be a civil violation and a fine not exceeding $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> may be imposed. Each day that a violation continues will be treated as a separate offense&mdash;All fines collected hereunder shall inure to and be recovered by the Town of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of town__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 14 SEPARABILITY</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|19|40:13">
<form.text>The invalidity of any provision of this ordinance shall not invalidate any other part.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 15 EFFECTIVE DATE</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
</para>

<name>Private clubs</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>

<section.body>
<form uuid="I439b74302f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>Definitions</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>“Private Club” as used in this section means any nonprofit association organized under the laws of this State which:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>Has been in existence at least one year prior to the filing of its application for a license to be issued pursuant to this chapter;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>Has at least 75 regular dues-paying members;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>Owns, hires, or leases a building or space within a building for the reasonable use of its members and guests with:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>Suitable kitchen and dining room space and equipment; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>A sufficient number of staff Employees for cooking, preparing, and serving meals for its members and guests; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>Has no member, officer, agent or Employee directly or indirectly receiving in the form of salary of other compensation, any profits from the sale of alcoholic beverages beyond a fixed salary. For purposes of paragraph (c)(3), “a fixed salary” means the amount of compensation paid any member, officer, agent, or Employee of a private club as may be fixed for him by its members at a prior annual meeting or by the governing body out of the general revenue of the club and shall not include a commission or any profits from the sale of alcoholic beverages. Tips or gratuities, which are added to the bills under club regulations, shall not be considered as profits from the sale of alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>License Fees</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>A license fee authorizing a private club to sell and dispense alcoholic beverages shall be paid by certified or cashier's check to the County by the licensee in the amount of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fee__rsqb__</inline.instr>, payable at the time of the application for the license or renewal thereof.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>Excise Tax</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|20|40:14">
<form.text>In addition to the excise taxes levied by the State, the County does hereby levy an excise tax of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of tax rate__rsqb__</inline.instr> per liter on all distilled spirits sold by a wholesaler to a private club. Said tax is imposed upon wholesalers and is payable on a monthly basis as set out under Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>. Accordingly, the County also imposes an excise tax on every purchase of a mixed drink in the amount of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of excise tax__rsqb__</inline.instr> of the purchase price of said beverage. Said tax shall be paid by the licensee to the County and remitted monthly in the manner prescribed under Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>

</form.para>

</outline.name.block>
<online.view>

<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I439d70002f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>Consumption of alcoholic beverages and beer prohibited in certain places; open containers of alcoholic beverages and beer prohibited in certain places.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>For the purposes of this section, “open container,” means any drinking or pouring vessel, including any open or unsealed bottle, jar, can, cup, or container without a lid or with a lid but with a straw protruding therefrom or with only a partial lid, with the contents being capable of immediate consumption.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>It shall be unlawful for any person to drink or consume any alcoholic beverage or beer or have an open container of alcoholic beverage or beer in or on any of the following places:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>public street, alley, avenue, highway;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>public sidewalk;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>public park;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>public school ground;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(5)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>any other public place;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(6)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>teen social clubs, as defined in Chapter <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of chapter__rsqb__</inline.instr> of this Code; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(7)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>any parking lot held open to use by the public.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>It shall be unlawful for any person to consume any alcoholic beverage or beer upon the private business premises of another without permission of the owner or person in control of such premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>All teen social clubs, as defined in Chapter <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of chapter__rsqb__</inline.instr> of this Code, shall post signs in visible locations prohibiting consumption of beer and alcoholic beverages on the premises as follows: “No consumption of or open containers of beer or alcoholic beverages permitted on these premises.” Such signs shall be located (1) at the entrance to the establishment, (2) inside the establishment near all exits, and (3) in the parking lot or parking lots of such establishments.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|21|40:15">
<form.text>This section shall not prohibit the sale or consumption of beer or alcoholic beverages permitted pursuant to a temporary beer permit issued by the Beer Board of the City or pursuant to a special occasion license issued by the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Alcoholic Beverage Commission provided that (1) the location of such sale or consumption has been designated in the temporary beer permit issued by the Beer Board of the City or in the special occasion license issued by the Alcoholic Beverage Commission, (2) the activities at such location conform to the requirements of the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> Code and the Alcoholic Beverage Commission, and (3) such sale and consumption is confined to the location designated in the temporary beer permit or special occasion license.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>

<designator>40:17</designator>
<name>Liquor in parks</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LUZ</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I43ab04902f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|23|40:17">
<form.text>POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES IN PUBLIC PARKS. No person shall possess or consume any alcoholic beverage in or at any public park or parkland operated or owned by the city of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|23|40:17">
<form.text>WARNING. Before issuing a citation for a violation of this ordinance, any police officer of the city may give an oral warning, or issue a written warning ticket. If the person or persons receiving the oral warning or warning ticket do not discontinue the violation a citation for ordinance violation shall be issued to the violator. If it appears necessary to make an arrest to preserve the public peace, a police officer may make an arrest for a violation of this ordinance, with or without a previous oral warning or warning ticket.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|23|40:17">
<form.text>SIGNS AND NOTICES. Signs shall be posted and notices shall be placed on bulletin boards in the parks, stating substantially as follows: “NO ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE MAY BE BROUGHT INTO THIS PARK OR CONSUMED IN THIS PARK. CITY ORDINANCE ENFORCED.” The signs shall be placed in locations to be visible on entering the park but, when possible, to be inconspicuous to persons in the park.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
</para>

<name>Alcohol, public access property</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>

<section.body>
<form uuid="I956a6220ac7d11eda381ace071fc2876">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>Definitions - the following terms shall have the meaning indicated:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>Alcoholic Beverages - as defined in the “Liquor Code” of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> (i.e. liquor, wine, malt, and brewed beverages);</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>Open Container - any container from which consumption of an alcoholic beverage is occurring;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>Public Access Property - any public street, alley, sidewalk, park, playground, ball field, recreation areas, commons, or parking lots; or any private parking lots open to public use (regardless if the private parking lot establishment is open or closed for business);</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>It shall be unlawful for any person to drink an alcoholic beverage upon any public access property within the City and it shall be unlawful for any person to have in such person's possession, or in a vehicle under such person's control, any open container containing an alcoholic beverage upon any public access property in the City.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>Any person who shall violate the provisions of this Ordinance, shall upon conviction thereof, be sentenced to pay a fine of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of sum__rsqb__</inline.instr> dollars plus the costs of prosecution, or in default of payment of same, to undergo imprisonment for five (5) days for the first offense; $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of sum__rsqb__</inline.instr> dollars plus the costs of prosecution, or in default of payment, imprisonment for ten (10) days for the second offense; and $ <inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of sum__rsqb__</inline.instr> dollars plus the costs of prosecution, or in default of payment, imprisonment for ninety (90) days for the third offense and any offense thereafter.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>Any police officer is hereby authorized to act on behalf of the Borough.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>All ordinances and parts of ordinances inconsistent herewith are hereby repealed.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|24|40:17.10">
<form.text>If any provision or part of this Ordinance is for any reason found to be unconstitutional, illegal, or invalid, such decision shall not affect or impair the validity of any of the remaining provisions or parts of this Ordinance. It is hereby declared as the intent of City Council that this Ordinance would have been adopted had such unconstitutional, illegal, or invalid provision or part not included herein.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 7.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
</para>
