<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:24</designator>
<name>Social host ordinance</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I43dd86402f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.para>
<form.text>This ordinance prohibits, and establishes penalties for, any person hosting an event or gathering where alcohol is present and being possessed or consumed by persons under twenty-one (21) years of age.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>
Be it enacted by the Board of Commissioners of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, State of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, as follows:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Purpose and Findings.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>The Board of Commissioners of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> intends to discourage underage possession and consumption of alcohol, even if done within the confines of a private residence, and intends to hold persons criminally responsible who host events or gatherings where persons under 21 years of age possess or consume alcohol regardless of whether the person hosting the event or gathering supplied the alcohol. The Board of Commissioners of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> finds that:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Events and gatherings held on private or public property where alcohol is possessed or consumed by persons under the age of 21 are harmful to those persons and constitute a potential threat to public health requiring prevention or abatement.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Prohibiting underage consumption acts to protect underage persons, as well as the general public, from injuries related to alcohol consumption, such as alcohol overdose or alcohol-related traffic collisions.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Alcohol is an addictive drug which, if used irresponsibly, could have drastic effects on those who use it as well as those who are affected by the actions of an irresponsible user.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Often, events or gatherings involving underage possession and consumption occur outside the presence of parents. However, there are times when the parent(s) is/are present and, condone the activity, and in some circumstances provide the alcohol.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Even though giving or furnishing alcohol to an underage person is a crime, it is difficult to prove, and an ordinance is necessary to help further combat underage consumption.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>A deterrent effect will be created by holding a person criminally responsible for hosting an event or gathering where underage possession or consumption occurs.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Authority.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>This ordinance is enacted pursuant to <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Stat. &sect;<inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Definitions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>For purposes of this ordinance, the following terms have the following meanings:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Alcohol.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>“Alcohol” means ethyl alcohol, hydrated oxide of ethyl, or spirits of wine, whiskey, rum, brandy, gin, or any other distilled spirits including dilutions and mixtures thereof from whatever source or by whatever process produced.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Alcoholic beverage.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>“Alcoholic beverage” means alcohol, spirits, liquor, wine, beer, and every liquid or solid containing alcohol, spirits, wine, or beer, and which contains one-half of one percent or more of alcohol by volume and which is fit for beverage purposes either alone or when diluted, mixed, or combined with other substances.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Event or gathering.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>“Event or gathering” means any group of three or more persons who have assembled or gathered together for a social occasion or other activity.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Host.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>“Host” means to aid, conduct, allow, entertain, organize, supervise, control, or permit a gathering or event.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Parent.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>“Parent” means any person having legal custody of a juvenile:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>As natural, adoptive parent, or step-parent;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>As a legal guardian; or</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>As a person to whom legal custody has been given by order of the court.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Person.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>“Person” means any individual, partnership, copartnership, corporation, or any association of one or more individuals.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(g)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Residence or Premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>“Residence” or “premises” means any home, yard, farm, field, land, apartment, condominium, hotel or motel room, or other dwelling unit, or a hall or meeting room, park, or any other place of assembly, public or private, whether occupied on a temporary or permanent basis, whether occupied as a dwelling or specifically for a party or other social function, and whether owned, leased, rented, or used with or without permission or compensation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(h)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Underage Person.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>“Underage person” is any individual under twenty-one (21) years of age.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Prohibited Acts.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>It is unlawful for any person(s) to;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>host or allow an event or gathering;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>at any residence, premises, or on any other private or public property;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>where alcohol or alcoholic beverages are present;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>when the person knows or reasonably should know that an underage person will or does</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(i)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>consume any alcohol or alcoholic beverage; or</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(ii)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>possess any alcohol or alcoholic beverage with the intent to consume it; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(5)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>the person fails to take reasonable steps to prevent possession or consumption by the underage person(s).</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>A person is criminally responsible for violating subdivision 4(a) above if the person intentionally aids, advises, hires, counsels, or conspires with or otherwise procures another to commit the prohibited act.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>A person who hosts an event or gathering does not have to be present at the event or gathering to be criminally responsible.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Exceptions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>This ordinance does not apply to conduct solely between an underage person and his or her parents while present in the parent's household.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>This ordinance does not apply to legally protected religious observances.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>This ordinance does not apply to retail intoxicating liquor or 3.2% malt liquor licensees, municipal liquor stores, or bottle club permit holders who are regulated by <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Stat. &sect;<inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>This ordinance does not apply to situations where underage persons are lawfully in possession of alcohol or alcoholic beverages during the course and scope of employment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Enforcement.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>This ordinance can be enforced by any police officer or sheriff's deputy in the county.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 7.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Severability.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>If any section, subsection, sentence, clause, phrase, word, or other portion of this ordinance is, for any reason, held to be unconstitutional or invalid, in whole, or in part, by any court of competent jurisdiction, such portion shall be deemed severable, and such unconstitutionality or invalidity shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this law, which remaining portions shall continue in full force and effect.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 8.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Penalty.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">
<form.text>Violation of Sec. 4 is a misdemeanor.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 9.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|32|40:24">

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:25</designator>
<name>Sale of alcohol to minors and intoxicated persons<sep/> Sales and service training</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I43e01e502f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.para>
<form.text>WHEREAS, the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> is a hospitality destination for families, visitors and community members alike; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, the City of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> includes alcohol outlets licensed by the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control for on and off-site sale of alcohol; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, stores, bars and restaurants which sell or serve alcohol to minors or to the intoxicated patron pose a threat to the public health and safety of the City of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, the threat to public health and safety includes the injuries and deaths caused by vehicle crashes, sexual assaults, domestic violence and other crimes which occur as a result of service of alcohol to minors or service to the intoxicated patron; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, Responsible Beverage Service and Sales (RBSS) training is a successful method for alcohol licensees to educate their managers and servers on the effects of over-service and service to minors, and on techniques to avoid over-service and service to minors; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, RBSS training provides alcohol licensees with a clear understanding of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control (ABC) and other state regulations, and is highly recommended by the ABC; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, training in RBSS and the accompanying certification gives credibility and distinction to alcohol sales and service as a profession; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, better trained staff will assist the alcohol licensee in protecting their valuable alcohol license, and in reducing their business liability; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, alcohol licensees who have RBSS trained staff demonstrate to patrons and other community members and agencies that public safety is their highest concern.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>
NOW, THEREFORE, the City Council of the City of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, in accordance with the freedom accorded to charter cities generally, and by the Charter of the City of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, specifically does ordain as follows:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 1: Definitions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>As used in this chapter, the following words and phrases have the meanings set forth in this section:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>“Alcoholic beverage” shall have the same meaning as in the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Business and Professions Code Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr> or any successor section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>“Alcohol outlet” means any physical location or structure from which any alcoholic beverage may be sold, delivered, or served at retail pursuant to a license granted by the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>“Business certificate” means a certificate or license authorizing a business to operate within the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>D</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>“Licensee” means any person or entity that has a license for the retail sale, delivery, or service of alcoholic beverages from the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>E</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>“Manager” means the person, regardless of job title or description, who has discretionary powers to organize, direct, carry on, control or direct the operation of an alcoholic outlet.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>F</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>“Server” means any person who, as part of his or her employment, sells, serves or delivers any alcoholic beverage.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>G</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>“Patron” means a customer who purchases alcohol through a sale, service or delivery.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>H</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>“Responsible Beverage Sales and Service Training” or “RBSS Training” means a training program conducted by the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control or by a certified RBSS Training Provider to train alcohol licensees, their managers and servers in responsible alcoholic beverage sales and service methods and practices.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 2: Responsible Beverage Service Training Required&mdash;Proof.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>No alcohol outlet may serve, sell, or arrange delivery to a patron any alcoholic beverages unless a manager, assistant manager or lead employee who has completed a Responsible Beverage Service and Sales Training course is on the premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>No licensee, manager or server shall sell, serve or deliver to a patron any alcoholic beverage unless he or she has completed RBSS Training. However, licensees, their managers and servers shall have ninety (90) days from the date of beginning of such activities or the effective dates of this Chapter, whichever is later, to complete RBSS Training. Businesses existing as of the effective date of this ordinance shall have one hundred eighty (180) days from the effective date of this ordinance to comply with this Chapter. Thereafter, all said businesses shall have ninety (90) days from the date of the beginning of such activities to comply with this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>Certification received from an RBSS Training program will be considered valid for a period of two years from the date of certification.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>D</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>Licensees shall be responsible for ensuring that all managers and servers they employ comply with this section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>E</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>Licensees shall maintain on the premises a file of proof of completion of the RBSS Training by the licensee, managers and servers that shall be available for inspection by any peace officer or other enforcement officer during regular business hours. The proof of completion shall include (1) the effective date of hire, (2) course-completion date and, if applicable, the course-renewal date, (3) the name of the certified RBSS Training completed, (4) a copy of each training certificate, if available, and (5) identifying information of the licensee, managers and servers, including the name, address, phone number and <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> driver's license number, if applicable.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>F</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>The City shall provide to all applicants for a business certificate that are alcohol licensees, as defined in this chapter, a summary of the requirements of this chapter together with its penalties for violation prior to issuing a business certificate or renewal.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Sec. 3: Violation&mdash;Penalty.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>Violation of any provision of this chapter or failure to comply with any requirement of this chapter is an infraction and shall be punishable in accordance with the provisions of Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr> of the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> Municipal Code. At the discretion of the prosecutor, a violation of this chapter may be charged as a misdemeanor.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|33|40:25">
<form.text>Civil Action. In addition to any other remedies provided in this Chapter, any violation of this Chapter may be enforced by civil action brought by the City pursuant to Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr> of this Code.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</para>
</form>

<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:26</designator>
<name>Sale of alcohol, prohibited locations</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I43e1cc002f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.name.block>
<name>SALE OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES NEAR CHURCHES. PUBLIC HOSPITALS. PUBLIC SCHOOLS OR OTHER EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS.</name>
</form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|34|40:26">
<form.text>
It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or engage in the business of selling alcoholic beverages within the City where the place of business is within 300 feet of any church, public hospital or within 1,000 feet of public schools or other educational institution. The measurement of the distance between the place of business where alcoholic beverages are sold and the church or public hospital shall be along the property lines of the street fronts and from front door to front door, and in direct line across intersections. The measurement of the distance between the place of business where alcoholic beverages are sold and the public schools shall be in a direct line from the property line of the public school to the property line of the place of business, and in a direct line across intersections.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|34|40:26">
<form.text>
This ordinance shall take effect immediately from and after its passage and publication in accordance with the provisions of the Charter of the City of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, and it is accordingly so ordained.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|34|40:26">
<form.text>
PASSED AND APPROVED THIS <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__ORDINAL NUMBER OF DAY__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> DAY OF <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__NAME OF MONTH__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__IDENTIFICATION OF YEAR__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|34|40:26">
<form.text>
PASSED AND ADOPTED THIS <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__ORDINAL NUMBER OF DAY__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> DAY OF <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__NAME OF MONTH__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__IDENTIFICATION OF YEAR__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.

<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:27</designator>
<name>Food service requirement, exemptions</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I43e352a02f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.para>
<form.text>Nationally recognized and chartered organizations such as veterans organizations, fraternal organizations, and other nonprofit organizations currently having tax exempt status under either the United States Internal Revenue Code or the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Income Tax Law shall not be required to operate a food establishment serving prepared food in order to sell alcoholic beverages. Such organization, however, dispensing or selling alcoholic beverages shall be subject to all County ordinance regulations and general licensing application requirements for licensees, provided, however, any applicants for temporary licenses may be exempted from certain ordinance regulations and application requirements if the County Manager, after consultation with the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Sheriff's Office, determines that such exemption will not violate the purposes of the Ordinance as set forth in Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>. Any applicant requesting a temporary license must qualify for said license by submitting an application on a form provided by the County Manager to <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> and by tendering a certified or cashier's check to <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> in the amount of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fee__rsqb__</inline.instr> per each day alcoholic beverages are sold. Said temporary license will be granted to the same applicant a maximum of five (5) days per year.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|36|40:27">
<form.text>
For profit businesses that possess a valid local government-issued alcohol license to sell alcohol for consumption on the premises, may make application with the County Manager for a one day permit to operate a cash bar at a location within <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> other than the licensed premises on a special event basis. Any licensee requesting a special event permit under this paragraph must qualify for said license by submitting an application on a form provided by the County Manager to <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> and by tendering a certified or cashier's check to <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> in the amount of $<inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fee__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> for each one day permit. Said special event permit will be granted to the same licensee a maximum of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__maximum number of special license__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>. For purposes of this paragraph, the phrase “cash bar” is limited to and shall only include the provision of alcoholic beverages for consumption at a banquet, function, luncheon, reception or other similar event, where guests pay for alcoholic drinks on a per drink basis.
</form.text>
</para>

<name>Sale of alcohol, nudity</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>

<form uuid="I43e59c902f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.para>
<form.text>WHEREAS, the Board of County Commissioners of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> finds and declares that nudity, coupled with the sale, presence or use of alcoholic beverages in public places, encourages undesirable behavior and is not in the best interests of the public health, safety, welfare and morals of the citizens of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr>; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, the Board of County Commissioners of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> has chosen to address the disturbances associated with mixing alcohol and nudity by means of a reasonable restriction upon any establishment, licensee, premises or bottle club licensed under the laws of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> to sell or allow the consumption of alcoholic beverages and upon any person present at any establishment, licensee, premises or bottle club licensed under the laws of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> to sell or allow the consumption of alcoholic beverages; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, as of the effective date of the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> Public Decency Ordinance, that Ordinance has been applicable countywide and is generally intended to prohibit a person from intentionally or recklessly appearing or being nude or causing another person to appear or be nude in a public place and in other places which may reasonably be observed by the public within <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, the Board of County Commissioners of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> hereby finds and declares that this Ordinance is in addition and supplemental to the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> Public Decency Ordinance and the provisions of state law; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, the Board of County Commissioners of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, finds and determines that this Ordinance is in the best interests of the public health, safety, welfare and morals of the citizens of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>
WHEREAS, the Board of County Commissioners finds and determines that this Ordinance is consistent with the provisions of state law and applicable county ordinances.
</form.text>

</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>This Part shall be known as the “<inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Nudity and Alcohol Separation Ordinance.”</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION THREE: Definitions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>The definitions enacted in Ordinance Number <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of ordinance__rsqb__</inline.instr> are hereby adopted and shall apply to the provisions of this Part; provided, however, that the definition of the term “Nude” shall also apply to the term “Nudity.”</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION FOUR: Prohibition against comingling of alcohol and nudity.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>It is unlawful within <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> for any manager, officer, agent, servant, employee, contractor, person in charge, customer or invitee of any premises, establishment, licensee or bottle club licensed under the laws of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> to possess, sell or allow the consumption of alcoholic beverages to knowingly, intentionally or recklessly exhibit, suffer, allow, permit, engage in, participate in, or be connected with nudity at or upon the licensed premises.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>It is unlawful within <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> for any person to be nude or to knowingly, intentionally or recklessly exhibit, suffer, allow, permit, engage in, participate in, or be connected with nudity upon the licensed premises in any bottle club, establishment, licensee or similar business licensed under the laws of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> to possess, sell or allow the consumption of alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>The combination of nudity and the possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages at any licensed location as set forth is subsections (a) and (b) and the act of permitting, condoning or allowing the possession, sale or consumption of alcoholic beverages within the County is hereby strictly prohibited and made unlawful.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|37|40:28">
<form.text>It is not a violation of this Part for any person to engage in the ordinary and customary bona fide use of an enclosed single sex public restroom, enclosed single sex functional shower or enclosed single sex locker and/or dressing-room facilities. It is also not a violation of this Part for a mother to breast feed her baby.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>

</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|38|40:29">

</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|38|40:29">
<form.text>Farm Winery</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|38|40:29">
<form.text>Means a domestic winery that has received the appropriate permit and authorization under the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Code, located on premises, a substantial portion of which is used for agricultural purposes, including the cultivation of grapes, berries, or fruits to be utilized in the manufacture or production of wine by the winery, or domestic winery that: (a) makes at least 40% of its annual production from agricultural produce grown in this state; (b) is owned and operated by persons who are engaged in the production of a substantial portion of the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> agricultural produce used in its annual production, and for this purpose, such production of a substantial portion of such <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> agricultural produce shall be determined by the Revenue Commissioner of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>; and (c) produces less than 100,000 gallons per year.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|38|40:29">
<form.text>Tasting Room</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|38|40:29">
<form.text>Means an outlet for the promotion of a Farm Winery's wine by providing samples of such wine to the public and for the sale of such wine at retail for consumption on the premises and for sale in closed packages for consumption off the premises. Samples of wine may be given complimentary or for a fee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION TWO..</form.text>
</form.para>

</form.para>

<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>

<form.text>A Farm Winery may sell its wine and the wine of any other <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Farm Winery licensee at retail in a Tasting Room on the premises of the winery for consumption on the premises and in closed packages for consumption off the premises and to sell its wine and the wine of any other <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Farm Winery licensee at retail for consumption on the premises and in closed packages for consumption off the premises in Tasting Rooms at a location that is one of the locations in the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> authorized by <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>

In addition to the qualifications set forth in Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr> of this Ordinance, an applicant for a Farm Winery license shall be required to submit at the time of application a Farm Winery license issued by the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Revenue Commissioner.</form.text>
</form.para>

<form.item>

</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|38|40:29">
<form.text>The license created in accord with this Section shall be limited to Farm Winery Tasting Rooms licensed by the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> in accord with Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>, and the licensee shall be permitted to perform only acts allowed in accord with such statutes. No license is hereby created authorizing any other use. In no event shall a Farm Winery license holder be entitled to receive a special event cash bar license as provided in <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>

<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|38|40:29">
<form.text>This Section shall not be construed so as to authorize a Farm Winery to sell wine on Sunday on premises that are not located on the property where such farm wine is produced. A Farm Winery located on the premises where the farm wine is produced that is licensed to sell wine in a Tasting Room or other licensed Farm Winery facility for consumption on the premises or in closed packages for consumption off the premises shall be authorized in accord with the terms hereof to sell its wine on Sundays from 12:30 p.m. until 11:59 p.m. in the Tasting Room or other licensed Farm Winery facility to the same extent as any other licenses issued in accord with the terms hereof would otherwise permit. Monday through Saturday, the selling or tasting of wine at a Farm Winery shall occur during those hours in Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of code reference__rsqb__</inline.instr> of this Ordinance.</form.text>

</name.block>

Excise taxes received by <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> after the 20th day of the month shall be charged a <inline.instr>__lsqb__percentage of penalty__rsqb__</inline.instr>% penalty. The $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of tax rate__rsqb__</inline.instr> per liter shall be prorated so that all containers of wine shall be taxed on the basis of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of tax rate__rsqb__</inline.instr>. It shall be unlawful and a violation of this Ordinance for any licensee in accord with the terms hereof to sell or deliver wine in any manner without collecting said tax.</form.text>

<name>Restrictions advertising to minors</name>
</outline.name.block>

<form uuid="I43eca1702f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>&sect; Section Definitions</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>All terms defined in this Division appear in italics.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>For purposes of this Division:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Advertising means printed matter that calls the public's attention to things for sale.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Alcoholic beverages means any substance containing one-half of one percent or more alcohol by volume and which is fit for consumption as a beverage either alone or when combined with other substances.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Billboard means any sign space that is permanently placed on or affixed to the ground, the sidewalk, a pole or post, or a building, and is not appurtenant to the use of the property, a product sold, or the sale or lease of the property on which displayed and which does not identify the place of business as purveyor of the merchandise or services advertised upon the sign. Billboard also means any sign space that is permanently placed on a vehicle that is used primarily for the purpose of displaying outdoor advertising.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Child-care center means a public or licensed private child care that has a continuous enrollment of no fewer than twenty-five (25) children and is clearly identified on the outside of the facility as a childcare center.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>City has the same meaning as in Municipal Code Section<inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Director has the same meaning as in Municipal Code Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Library means any public library operated by the City and clearly identified on the outside of the facility as a library.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Person has the same meaning as in Municipal Code Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Playground means any outdoor premises or grounds owned or operated by the City that contains any play or athletic equipment used or intended to be used by minors.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>Recreation center or facility means any recreation center or facility owned or operated by the City, and clearly identified on the outside of the facility as a City recreation center or facility.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>School means any public or licensed private elementary or secondary school, that is clearly identified on the outside of the facility as a school, attendance at which satisfies the compulsory education laws of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>&sect; Section Measure of Distance</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>The distance between any billboard and any school, playground, recreation center or facility, child care center, or library shall be measured in a straight line, without regard to intervening structures, from the billboard to the closest property line of the school, playground, recreation center or facility, child care center, or library.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>&sect; Section Advertising Restrictions</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|40|40:31">
<form.text>It is unlawful for any person, business, or retailer to place or maintain, or cause to be placed or maintained, any advertising of alcoholic beverages on a billboard that is within 500 feet of a school, playground, recreation center or facility, child care center, or library or that is more than 500 feet and the billboard face and its advertisement are clearly visible from a school, playground, recreation center or facility, child care center, or library. This section does not apply to any noncommercial message.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>&sect; Section Enforcement</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
</para>
</form>

</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|41|40:32">
<form.text>Sunday sales&mdash;Bona fide restaurants.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|41|40:32">
<form.text>A bona fide restaurant, which has a valid permit for consumption on the premises, shall be permitted to sell and serve alcoholic beverages on Sundays without the requirement of obtaining an additional permit, during the hours such establishment is permitted to be open for business under the applicable zoning ordinances, but in no event before the hour of 12:00 noon or after the hour of 12:00 midnight, unless otherwise permitted to do so under Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>

However, such cocktail lounge may be opened during such hours authorized by and under a permit issued pursuant to this section. <form.text>A bona fide private club, as defined in this chapter, shall be permitted to sell or serve alcoholic beverages on Sunday, but only between the hours of 12:00 noon and 12:00 midnight, unless otherwise permitted to do so under Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>. Such a bona fide private club, however, may sell or serve only the types of alcoholic beverages that it is licensed to sell or serve at other times.</form.text>

<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|41|40:32">
<form.text>Any bona fide private club desiring to serve alcoholic beverages on Sundays in accordance with this section shall first apply to the chief of police for a Sunday alcoholic beverage permit for private clubs. Any applicant for such a permit shall furnish such information relative to its operation as may be required by the chief of police, including, but not necessarily limited to, articles of incorporation and other documents evidencing that the applicant is a bona fide private club. The chief of police shall arrange for a representative of his department to inspect the applicant's premises to determine whether a bona fide private club is being operated on such premises. If the chief of police is satisfied that a bona fide private club is being operated on the premises of the applicant, he or she shall issue a Sunday alcoholic beverage permit for private clubs which shall be displayed in a conspicuous place on the premises of the applicant. Any permit issued pursuant to this section shall be subject to revocation or suspension for any grounds that a retail dealer's basic liquor permit may be revoked or suspended and also if the applicant should fail to continue to operate a bona fide private club.</form.text>
</form.para>

The annual fee for the issuance of a Sunday alcoholic beverage permit for private clubs shall be $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of annual fee__rsqb__</inline.instr>, which shall be paid in cash to the city prior to the issuance of the permit.</form.text>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:33</designator>
<name>Hotel/Motel in-room service</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I43f0e7302f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|42|40:33">
<form.text>“In-room service” is the provision of a cabinet or other facility located in a hotel or motel guest room which contains beer, wine, and/or distilled spirits and which is provided upon written request of the guest and which is accessible by lock and key only to the guest and for which the sale of the beer, wine, and/or distilled spirits contained therein is final at the time requested except for a credit which may be given to the guest for any unused portion.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|42|40:33">
<form.text>Any hotel-motel that acquires this “in-room service” shall also be required to obtain a consumption on the premises license and meet all of the requirements of this Ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|42|40:33">
<form.text>No hotel-motel shall be authorized to provide “in-room service” until it has been issued a special license to do so. A license fee of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of sum__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall be imposed to provide only beer, wine, and/or distilled spirits.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|42|40:33">
<form.text>The sale of beer, wine, and/or distilled spirits by “in-room service” shall be subject to all restrictions and limitations relative to the retail sale of any alcoholic beverages, except as provided otherwise in this Ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</para>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:34</designator>
<name>Hotel, conditional use license</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LIC</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I43f331202f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.name.block>
<name>HOTEL CONDITIONAL LICENSE (PLENARY RETAIL CONSUMPTION LICENSE).</name>
</form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>
A plenary retail consumption license may be issued to the owner or operator of a hotel with less than 100 rooms, or to the owner or operator of a bona fide restaurant which is located within the same building or the following restrictions and regulations:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>No such license may be transferred by the licensee to any other person or to any other locality, except to a person owning or operating such a bona fide hotel or owning or operating such a bona fide restaurant within the principal structure as the hotel, at the same location or the principal owner of the hotel.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Any such license for or transferred to a hotel owner or operator or to a person owning or operating a bona fide restaurant located within the same building or structure as the hotel shall remain in force only so long as a bona fide hotel is actually being operated at such location and such location and such license shall be revoked should the hotel cease operating as such at such a location. A bona fide hotel shall only be one whose main business is renting of rooms to transients with hotel service. The city council shall have the full right to determine what a bona fide hot council shall be final.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Sale or consumption of alcoholic beverages shall be permitted with meals served to customers seated at tables in the room or and used as dining room space.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Guest Rooms may contain mini bars provided containers or packages of spirits or wine sold by means of a minibar shall hold not less than 50 nor more than 200 milliliters, and that the said minibar shall be restocked with alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage only during hours when the hotel is permitted to sell alcoholic liquor and cereal malt beverage as a drinking establishment. Access to these guestrooms containing minibars, via a key, magnetic card, or other device, shall be provided only to guests who are registered to stay in such room, and who are 21 years or more in age.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>The licensed premises shall include only that portion of the hotel building or structure open to the general public for dining where meals are actually sold and served on a regular basis or where the alcoholic beverages are stored. A premises licensed under this section may provide tables and a bar/lounge area at which alcoholic beverages may be served without meals for the use of patrons. The number of bar stools shall be calculated as one bar stool per four seats of dining. The maximum capacity of the bar area shall not exceed 90 people having a maximum capacity of 50 seats, 15 bar stools and a standing capacity of 25. Such bar/lounges shall offer its full dining menu. The bar/lounge area should be delineated included in computing the floor space required by this section for obtaining such license.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Notwithstanding any provisions herein to the contrary, if the hotel contains conference or meeting rooms which have access from the regular restaurant facilities and which are or may be used from time to time for private meetings, banquets, conferences, parties or other similar occasions may be served to persons attending such private meeting, conference or party by the licensee. Such conference or meeting room shall be considered part of the licensed premises if so requested by the licensee.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>7.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Any such licensee shall, as a condition of obtaining and retaining such license, operate the licensed premises as a bona fide restaurant and shall serve or cause to be served three meals a day, being breakfast, lunch and dinner and shall be open for business a minimum of six days per week for a minimum of 48 weeks per Such license shall be revoked should the holder thereof cease operating such bona fide restaurant.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>8.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>There shall be at least 12 square feet of floor space in the dining area for each seat and the computation of said dining area should be used for kitchen, pantry, storage, rest-rooms or any other purpose than dining. After initial approval, such licensed premises shall not be altered or rearranged without first obtaining approval of the city council.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>9.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>There shall be located on the premises adequate washrooms and toilet facilities for the purpose of servicing the customers of the restaurant, one for men and one for women. For the first 150 seats or fraction thereof in the dining room area, the men's lavatory shall contain two water closets, one urinal and one wash basin. For the first 150 seats or fraction thereof in the dining room area, the women's lavatory shall contain two water closets and one wash basin. For each additional 75 or fraction thereof in dining seating capacity over 150, there shall be one additional water closet required in each of said lavatories an additional 100 or fraction thereof in dining seating capacity over 150, there shall be an additional wash basin required in each lavatory.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>10.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>There shall be suitable facilities on the licensed premises for temporary storage of coats, hats, umbrellas, overshoes and other items of clothing outside the dining area.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>11.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Daily food and drink specials shall be permitted, however “timed” happy hours with a defined period of time where drinking is encouraged are prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>12.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>The licensee shall keep and maintain accurate records of all sales sufficient to disclose what receipts were derived from the sale of alcoholic beverages and what receipts were derived from food stuffs, which records shall be open to inspection any time by the licensing body or its representatives, and may be kept under its supervision as directed if desired. In the event that inspection of the records of any licensee discloses that over 50% of the gross receipts are derived from the sale of alcoholic beverages, the licensing body may, in its discretion, after notice and proper hearing, revoke the license.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>13.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>The City council shall further have the right to decline to issue such license, whether or not applications may be received conforming to the above regulations and conditions, where they shall deem any application by reason of location, increased traffic congestion, structural inadequacies of licensed premises, fire or health detrimental to the health, morals, safety or welfare of the town.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>14.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Any license issued under this section shall bear the notation “Hotel Conditional License.” Restaurant conditional license (Retail Restaurant conditional licenses) may be issued to operators of bona fide restaurants, defined in Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr> of the Revised Statutes; subject however, to the owing restrictions and regulations:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>No such license may be transferred by the licensee to any other person or to any other locality, except to a person operating such a bona fide restaurant as hereinafter more particularly defined and restricted at the same or such other approved locality, at the discretion of council.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>A premises licensed under this section may provide tables and a bar/lounge area at which alcoholic beverages may be served without meals for the use or patrons; The number of bar stools shall be calculated as one bar stool per four seats of dining. The maximum capacity of the bar/lounge area shall not exceed 90 people having a maximum capacity of 50 seats, 15 bar stools and a standing capacity of 25. Such bar/lounges shall offer its full dining menu. The bar/lounge area should be delineated by a knee wall, railing or architectural feature to designate the limits of the bar/lounge area. Each seat at tables provided for this purpose shall be included in computing the floor space required by this section and shall also be included in the total seats meet the requirement for obtaining such license. To qualify as a bona fide restaurant under this section, the premises must ply with the following requirements:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>The premises must have a seating capacity at tables for at least 25 persons at one set of counters on the licensed premises even though such counter may be in a room separated from the portion of the restaurant where alcoholic beverages are served.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>No room on the licensed premises devoted to the purposes of dining shall contain fewer than 300 hundred square feet of floor space, exclusive of any spaced used for kitchen, pantry, storage or any other purpose than dining.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>There shall be at least area for each seat, and the computation of said dining area shall not include any space used for kitchen, pantry, storage, rest rooms or any other purpose than dining.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>d</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Men's lavatory. For the first 75 seats or fraction thereof in the dining room area, the men's lavatory shall contain one water closet, one urinal and one wash basin. For each additional 75 or fraction thereof in dining capacity over 75, there shall be one additional water closet and one additional urinal required in the men's lavatory.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>e</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|43|40:34">
<form.text>Women's lavatory. For the first 150 seats or fraction thereof in the dining room area, the women's lavatory shall contain two water closets.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form>
