<section.body>
<form uuid="I441363502f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>FINDINGS.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>The City Council of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> hereby finds and declares as follows:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, scientific studies have concluded that cigarette smoking causes chronic lung disease, coronary heart disease, stroke, cancer of the lungs, larynx, esophagus, mouth, and bladder, and contributes to cancer of the cervix, pancreas, and kidneys; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, the use of cigars is known to cause lung, larynx, esophageal, and oral cancer; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, more than 440,000 people die in the United States from tobacco related diseases every year, making it the nation's leading cause of preventable illness; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, the World Health Organization (WHO) estimates that by 2030, tobacco will account for 10 million deaths per year, making it the greatest cause of death worldwide; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, deaths from smoking around the world will soon outnumber those from AIDS, tuberculosis, traffic accidents, murder, and suicide combined; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has found secondhand smoke to be a risk to public health, and has classified secondhand smoke as a group A carcinogen, the most dangerous class of carcinogen; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, exposure to secondhand smoke is the third leading cause of preventable death in this country, killing over 52,000 nonsmokers each year, including 3,000 deaths from lung cancer; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, between 4,200 and 7,440 nonsmokers die of ischemic heart disease from secondhand smoke each year in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, 87.9 of nonsmokers showed detectable levels of cotinine (a metabolite of nicotine) in their blood, the most likely source of which is secondhand smoke exposure; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, secondhand smoke exposure adversely affects fetal growth, with elevated risk of low birth weight and increased risk of Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) in infants of mothers who smoke; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, secondhand smoke exposure causes as many as 300,000 children in the United States to suffer from lower respiratory tract infections, such as pneumonia and bronchitis, exacerbates childhood asthma, and increases the risk of acute, chronic, middle ear infection in children; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, the total cost of smoking in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> was estimated to be $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of cost__rsqb__</inline.instr> per resident or $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of cost__rsqb__</inline.instr> per smoker per year, for a total of nearly $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of total cost__rsqb__</inline.instr> in smoking related costs in 1999 alone; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, smoking-related health care costs in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> in 1999 totaled $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of health care costs__rsqb__</inline.instr>, an estimated <inline.instr>__lsqb__percentage of health care costs__rsqb__</inline.instr>% of which is paid for by public sources; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, almost <inline.instr>__lsqb__percentage of adult smokers__rsqb__</inline.instr>% of adult smokers started smoking at or before age 18; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, it is estimated that <inline.instr>__lsqb__percentage of youth__rsqb__</inline.instr>% of youth in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> smoke and smoking in front of children is likely to increase the likelihood that they will smoke; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, state law acknowledges the harms of secondhand smoke by prohibiting the sale or furnishing of cigarettes, tobacco products or smoking paraphernalia to minors, as well as the purchase, receipt, or possession of tobacco products by minors; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, with certain exceptions, state law prohibits smoking inside an enclosed place of employment; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, state law prohibits public school students from smoking or using tobacco products while on campus, while attending school-sponsored activities, or while under the supervision or control of school district employees; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, state law prohibits smoking in playgrounds and tot lots and within 20 feet of the main entrances and exits of public buildings and expressly authorizes local communities to enact additional restrictions;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Air Resources Board has determined that second-hand smoke is a toxic air contaminant, finding that exposure to second-hand smoke has serious health effects including low birth-weight babies; Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS); increased respiratory infections in children; asthma in children and adults; lung, sinus and breast cancer; heart disease; and death;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>WHEREAS, the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Air Resources Board's determination will lead to a rulemaking process that will take many months to complete and will likely mirror the requirements of this ordinance in order to protect public health in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>NOW THEREFORE, it is the intent of the City Council in enacting this ordinance, to provide for the public health, safety, and welfare by discouraging the inherently dangerous behavior of tobacco use near nontobacco users; by protecting children from exposure to smoking and tobacco; by reducing the potential for children to associate smoking and tobacco with a healthy lifestyle; by protecting the public from smoking and tobacco-related litter and pollution; and by affirming and promoting the family-friendly atmosphere of the City's public places.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>This chapter may be referred to as the city's “Comprehensive Second-Hand Smoke Control Ordinance.”</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>The purposes of this chapter are to:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Protect the public health, safety and general welfare by prohibiting smoking in public places under circumstances where other persons will be exposed to secondhand smoke,</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Assure a cleaner and more hygienic environment for the City, its residents, and its natural resources, including its creeks and streams,</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Strike a reasonable balance between the needs of persons who smoke and the needs of nonsmokers, including children, to breathe smoke-free air, recognizing the threat to public health and the environment which smoking causes, and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>D</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Recognize the right of residents and visitors to the City to be free from unwelcome second-hand smoke.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>The following definitions shall govern construction of this chapter unless the context clearly requires otherwise:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Business” means any sole proprietorship, partnership, joint venture, corporation, association, or other entity formed for profit-making purposes or that has an Employee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Common Area at a Shopping Mall” means any indoor or outdoor common area of a Shopping Mall accessible to and usable by the occupants or customers of more than retail establishment, including but not limited to halls, lobbies, outdoor eating areas, play areas and parking lots.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Employee” means any person who is employed or retained as an independent contractor by any Employer or any person who volunteers his or her services for an Employer, association, Nonprofit Entity.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Employer” means any person, partnership, corporation, association, nonprofit or other entity who or which employs or retains the service of one or more Employees.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Enclosed Area” means:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>any covered or partially covered area having more than 50% of its perimeter walled or otherwise closed to the outside such as, for example, a covered porch with more than two walls; or</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>any space open to the sky (hereinafter “uncovered”) having more than 75% of its perimeter walled or otherwise closed to the outside such as, for example, a courtyard;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>except that an uncovered space of three thousand (3,000) square feet or more is not an Enclosed Area, such as, for example, a field in an open-air arena.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Multi-Unit Residence” means a building or portion thereof that contains more than one dwelling space each of which consists of independent living facilities for one or more persons, including but not limited to single-room occupancy hotels (SROs), congregate care facilities other than those conducted in single-family residential structures, and dormitories.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(g)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Multi-Unit Residence Common Area” means any common area of a Multi-Unit Residence accessible to and usable by the occupants of more than one dwelling, including but not limited to halls, lobbies, laundry rooms, outdoor eating areas, play areas and swimming pools.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(h)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Nonprofit Entity” means any entity that meets the requirements of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Corporations Code Section <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr> as well as any corporation, unincorporated association or other entity created for charitable, religious, philanthropic, educational, political, social or similar purposes, the net proceeds of which are committed to the promotion of the objectives of the entity and not to private gain. A public agency is not a nonprofit entity within the meaning of this section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(i)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Place of Employment” means any area under the legal or de facto control of an Employer, Business or Nonprofit Entity that an Employee or the general public may enter in the normal course of operations, but regardless of the hours of operation, including, for example, indoor and outdoor work areas, construction sites, vehicles used in employment or for business purposes, taxis, employee lounges, conference and banquet rooms, bingo and gaming facilities, long-term health facilities, warehouses, and, while Employees, children or patients are present, private residences that are used as child-care or health-care facilities subject to licensing requirements.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(j)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Playground” means any park or Recreational Area designed in part to be used by children that has play or sports equipment installed or has been designated or landscaped for play or sports activities, or any similar facility located on public or private school grounds, or on city property.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(k)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Present” means with a Reasonable Distance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(l)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Public Place” means any public or private place open to the general public regardless of any fee or age requirement, including, for example, streets, sidewalks, plazas, bars, restaurants, clubs, stores, stadiums, parks, Playgrounds, taxis, and buses.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(m)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Reasonable Distance” means a distance of 20 feet or, with respect to a designated smoking area, such larger area as the city manager reasonably determines in writing to be necessary in a given circumstance to ensure that occupants of an area in which smoking is prohibited are not exposed to secondhand smoke created by smokers outside the area.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(n)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Recreational Area” means any public or private area open to the public for recreational purposes whether or not any fee for admission is charged, including, for example, parks, gardens, sporting facilities, stadiums, and Playgrounds.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(o)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Shopping Mall” means any parcel of land zoned and used for retail sales by more than one retailer that is jointly operated or which includes shared parking facilities.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(p)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Smoking” means possessing (and “Smoke” means to possess) a lighted pipe, lighted cigar, or lighted cigarette of any kind, or the lighting of a pipe, cigar, or cigarette of any kind, including, but not limited to, any Tobacco Product, or any other weed or plant.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(q)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Tobacco Product” means any substance containing tobacco leaf, including but not limited to cigarettes, cigars, pipe tobacco, snuff, chewing tobacco, dipping tobacco, bidis, or any other preparation of tobacco.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(r)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“Unenclosed area” means any area which is not an Enclosed Area.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Public and Other Places Where Smoking Prohibited. Except as otherwise provided by this chapter or by state or federal law, smoking is prohibited everywhere in the city, including but not limited to:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Public Places;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Places of Employment;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Multi-Unit Residence Common Areas; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Enclosed and Unenclosed Places of Hotels, Businesses, Restaurants, and Bars, and other public accommodations.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Places Where Smoking Permitted. Notwithstanding paragraph (a) of this subsection, Smoking is permitted in the following locations within the City, unless otherwise provided by state or federal law:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Private Residential Property, other than those used as a child-care or health-care facility subject to licensing requirements when Employees, children or patients are present. Nothing in this ordinance shall require a person or entity who or which owns or controls a private residential property, including but not limited to a condominium association or an apartment owner, to permit smoking and such a person may choose to prohibit smoking throughout the property he, she or it owns or controls.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>In up to 20% of guest rooms in any hotel or motel, if the hotel or motel permanently designates at least 80% of its guest rooms as nonsmoking rooms, appropriately signs nonsmoking rooms and permanently removes ashtrays and matches from them. Smoking rooms shall be segregated from nonsmoking rooms on separate floors, wings, or portions of either; smoking and nonsmoking rooms shall not be interspersed. Nothing in this ordinance shall require a hotel or motel to provide smoking rooms and the owner or operator of a hotel or motel may choose to prohibit smoking throughout the property.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Designated Unenclosed Areas in Shopping Mall Common Areas (“smokers' outposts”), provided that (i) there is not more than one square foot of unenclosed area designated for smoking for every 20,000 square feet of rentable Enclosed or Unenclosed Space a Shopping Mall provided that each Shopping Mall may have at least one smokers' outpost of 40 or fewer square feet in area, (ii) the area is prominently marked with signs, (iii) it is located the greatest distance practicable, and at least five (5) feet, from any doorway or opening into an Enclosed area or any access way from parking facilities to the retail areas of the Shopping Mall, (iv) smoke is not permitted to enter adjacent area in which smoking is prohibited by this chapter, other law or by the owner, lessee or licensee of the adjacent property, and (v) the location(s) of the smokers' outpost(s) is or are approved in writing by the community development director of the city based on the standards of this paragraph and the goals of this chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Any outdoor area in which no nonsmoker is Present and, due to the time of day or other factors, it is not reasonable to expect another person to arrive.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>No person shall dispose of Smoking waste or place or maintain a receptacle for Smoking waste in an area in which Smoking is prohibited by this chapter or other law, including within any Reasonable Distance required by this chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>No person shall Smoke in an area in which Smoking is otherwise permitted by this chapter or other law within a Reasonable Distance from any entrance, opening, crack, or vent into an Enclosed Area in which Smoking is prohibited by this chapter, other law or by the owner, lessee or licensee of that Enclosed Area.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>No person, Employer, Business, or Nonprofit Entity shall knowingly permit Smoking in an area under his, her, or its legal or de facto control in which smoking is prohibited by this chapter or other law.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>No person, Employer, Business, or Nonprofit Entity shall allow the placement or maintenance of a receptacle for Smoking waste in an area under his, her, or its legal or de facto control in which smoking is prohibited by this chapter or other law.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, any owner, landlord, Employer, Business, Nonprofit Entity, or other person who or which has legal or de facto control over any property may declare any area in which Smoking would otherwise be permitted to be a nonsmoking area and, provided that signs are posted giving notice of the Smoking restriction, Smoking in or within a Reasonable Distance of that area shall constitute a violation of this chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>“No Smoking” or “Smoke Free” signs, with letters of no less than one inch in height or the international “No Smoking” symbol (consisting of a pictorial representation of a burning cigarette enclosed in a red circle with a red bar across it) or any alternative signage approved by the community development director of the city shall be conspicuously posted at each entrance to a Public Place in which Smoking is prohibited by this chapter, by the person, Employer, Business, or Nonprofit Entity who or which has legal or de facto control of such place. The city manager shall post signs at each entrance to a Public Place in which Smoking is prohibited by this Chapter which is owned or controlled by the city. Signage required by this paragraph shall not be subject to chapter <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of chapter__rsqb__</inline.instr> (“Signs”) of this code. Notwithstanding this provision, the presence or absence of signs shall not be a defense to the violation of any other provision of this chapter except as to an area in which Smoking is prohibited only by paragraph (c) of this subsection.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>A violation of this ordinance shall constitute a misdemeanor punishable pursuant to chapter <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of chapter__rsqb__</inline.instr> of this code unless the prosecutor determines to prosecute it as an infraction as authorized by Sec. <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>The city council hereby declares that exposing other persons to secondhand smoke constitutes a public nuisance and may be remedied as such.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>No person shall cause, permit, aid, abet, or conceal a violation of any provision of this chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>The remedies provided by this chapter are cumulative and in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>The city prosecutor, city attorney, any peace officer or city code enforcement officer may enforce this chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>The city attorney or city prosecutor may also bring a civil action to enforce this chapter and to obtain the remedies specified below or otherwise available in equity or at law.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Any person acting for the interests of him-, her-, or itself, or of its members, or of the general public (hereinafter “a Private Enforcer”) may bring a civil action to enforce this chapter with the remedies specified below, if both of the following requirements are met:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>The action is commenced more than 60 days after the Private Enforcer has given written notice of an alleged violation of this chapter to the city attorney and to the alleged violator.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>No person acting on behalf of the city or the state has commenced or is prosecuting an action regarding the violation(s) which was or were the subject of the notice on the date the private action is filed.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>A Private Enforcer shall provide a copy of his, her or its action to the city attorney within seven days of filing it.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Upon settlement or judgment of an action brought pursuant to paragraph (g) of this subsection, the Private Enforcer shall give the city attorney notice of that settlement or judgment and of the final disposition of the case. No Private Enforcer may settle such an action unless the city attorney or the court determines the settlement to be reasonable in light of the purposes of this chapter and any settlement in violation of this requirement may be set aside upon motion to a court of competent jurisdiction by the city attorney or city prosecutor.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Upon proof of a violation of this chapter, the court shall award the following:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Damages in the amount of either:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(i)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>upon proof, actual damages; or</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(ii)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>with insufficient or no proof of damages, $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for each violation of this chapter (hereinafter “Statutory Damages”). Unless otherwise specified in this chapter, each day of a continuing violation shall constitute a separate violation. Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, no Private Enforcer suing on behalf of the general public shall recover Statutory Damages based upon a violation of this chapter if a previous claim brought on behalf of the general public for Statutory Damages and based upon the same violation has been adjudicated, whether or not the Private Enforcer was a party to that earlier adjudication.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Restitution to the appropriate party or parties of the gains obtained by way of violation of this chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Exemplary damages, where it is proven by clear and convincing evidence that the defendant is guilty of oppression, fraud, malice, or a conscious disregard for the public health and safety.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(4)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Attorneys' fees and costs reasonably incurred by a successful party in prosecuting or defending an action. Any damages awarded in an action brought by the city attorney or city prosecutor shall be paid into the city's general fund unless the court determines that they should be paid to a damaged third party.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Upon proof of at least one violation of this chapter, a Private Enforcer, the city prosecutor, city attorney, any peace officer or code enforcement official may obtain an injunction against further violations of this chapter or as, to small claims court actions, a judgment payable on condition that a further violation of this chapter occur within a time specified by the court.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(g)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Notwithstanding any legal or equitable bar, a Private Enforcer may bring an action to enforce this chapter solely on behalf of the general public. When a Private Enforcer do so, nothing about such an action shall act to preclude or bar the Private Enforcer from bringing a subsequent action on his, her or its own behalf based upon the same facts.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(h)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|61|40:44">
<form.text>Nothing in this chapter shall prohibit a Private Enforcer from bringing a civil action in small claims court to enforce this chapter, so long as the amount in demand and the relief sought are within the jurisdiction of small claims court.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>40:48</designator>
<name>Vending machines and sales to minors prohibited</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>LGV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>ORD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I44192fb02f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.para>
<form.text>Whereas, the U.S. Surgeon General has repeatedly stated that cigarette smoking is a leading cause of cancer, heart disease and various other medical disorders; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>
The Director of the National Institute on Drug Abuse has found that the majority of Americans who die each year from cigarette smoking became addicted to nicotine as adolescents before the legal age of majority; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>
The Director of the National Institute on Drug Abuse has found that cigarette smoking may be predictive of adolescent illicit drug use; and
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>
Cigarette vending machines have provided minors with easy access to cigarettes in contravention of the public policy of the State of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> and this municipality of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>;
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>
Therefore, it is ordained by the Council of the City of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, that:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>FINDINGS. The City Council of the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> finds that the facts stated in the preamble to this ordinance are true.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>DEFINITIONS. As used in this ordinance, the following words and phrases shall have the following meanings, unless the context clearly indicates that a different meaning is intended.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>ILLEGAL DISTRIBUTION OF CIGARETTES OR OTHER TOBACCO PRODUCTS.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>No manufacturer, producer, distributor, wholesaler or retailer of cigarettes or other tobacco products, or any agent, employee or representative of a manufacturer, producer, distributor, wholesaler or retailer of cigarettes or other tobacco products shall do any of the following:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>Give, sell or otherwise distribute cigarettes or other tobacco products to any minor;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>Give, sell or distribute cigarettes or other tobacco products in any place that does not have posted in a conspicuous place a sign stating that giving, selling or otherwise distributing cigarettes or other tobacco products to a person under 18 years of age is prohibited by law; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>Give, sell or distribute cigarettes or other tobacco products to any person without first verifying, via a photo identification such as a drivers license, that the person is 18 years old or older.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>CIGARETTE VENDING MACHINES PROHIBITED.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>The sale or distribution of cigarettes or any tobacco product via use of a vending machine is prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>No person or business entity of any type shall permit, facilitate or condone the sale or distribution of any cigarette or other tobacco product, via a vending machine, at his or her establishment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>Exceptions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(1)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>An employer may provide cigarette or other tobacco product vending machines for employees at the work establishment if the vending machines are not accessible to the public and persons under 18 years of age are not employees at the establishment. The employer must certify in writing to the Chief of Police that there are no other acceptable alternatives for the sale or distribution of tobacco products at the establishment, and that persons under 18 years of age are not employed at the establishment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(2)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>Adult Correctional Facilities may provide cigarette or other tobacco product vending machines in places within the facility that are inaccessible to minors. The Director of the Correctional Facility must certify in writing to the Chief of Police that there are no other acceptable alternatives for the sale or distribution of tobacco products at the facility and that persons under 18 years of age have no access to the machines at the facility.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(3)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>Substance abuse treatment facilities may provide cigarette or other tobacco product vending machines in places within the facility accessible only to individuals undergoing treatment at the facility. The physician in charge at the facility must certify in writing to the Chief of Police that lack of a tobacco product vending machine will be counterproductive to the treatment regime of the individuals undergoing treatment at the facility and that persons under 18 years of age will not have access to any vending machine.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>CIGARETTE PURCHASE, POSSESSION OR SMOKING BY MINORS PROHIBITED. No person under 18 years of age shall purchase, possess or consume in any manner or form cigarettes or any tobacco product.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>Possession is not an offense if the person under 18 years of age was in possession of an unopened container or containers of the cigarette or other tobacco product while performing their specified duties at a lawful place of employment.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>PARENT, GAURDIAN, CARETAKER. No parent, legal guardian, or caretaker shall permit, allow, condone or facilitate a child under 18 years of age to purchase, possess or consume in any manner or form cigarettes or any tobacco products.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 7.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<form.text>PENALTY. Any person, firm or corporation violating any provision of this ordinance shall be fined not less than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of minimum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> nor more than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of maximum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for each offense, and a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<para.text>
Based, with some changes in wording, on an ordinance furnished courtesy of Keith A. Wilkowski, City Attorney, Toledo, Ohio.
</para.text>
</para>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>2.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|65|40:48">
<para.text>
Check state law for age for which sale of tobacco is illegal.
</para.text>
</para>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>

</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="I441c15e02f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.para>
<form.text>The County Board of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Hereby Ordains:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Purpose.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The purpose of this ordinance is to regulate the sale, possession, and use of tobacco and tobacco related devices; to protect minors from the serious effects associated with the use of tobacco; to further the public policy of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> in regard to preventing young people from starting to smoke; and to protect the general health and welfare of citizens of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Definitions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Tobacco.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Tobacco” means cigarettes; cigars; pipe tobacco; cheroots; stogies; perique; granulated, plug cut, crimp cut, ready-rubbed, and other smoking tobacco; snuff; snuff flour; cavendish; shorts; plug and twist tobacco; fine cut and other chewing tobaccos; refuse scraps, clippings, cuttings and sweepings of tobacco; and other kinds and forms of tobacco, prepared in such manner as to be suitable for chewing, sniffing, or smoking in a pipe or other tobacco related devices.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Tobacco Related Devices.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Tobacco related devices” means cigarette papers, or pipes for smoking.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Self-Service Merchandising.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Self-Service Merchandising” shall mean open displays of tobacco or tobacco related devices in a manner where any person has access to the tobacco or tobacco related devices, without assistance from a clerk of the licensee. Self-service merchandising shall not include vending machines.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Vending Machine.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Vending Machine” shall mean any mechanical, electric or electronic, or other type of device which dispenses tobacco or tobacco related devices upon the insertion of money, tokens, or other form of payment directly into the machine by the person seeking to purchase the tobacco or tobacco related device.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Individually Packaged.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Individually packaged” shall mean the practice of selling tobacco wrapped individually for sale. Individually wrapped tobacco shall include, but not be limited to, single cigarette packs, single bags or cans of loose tobacco in any form, and single cans or other packaging of snuff or chewing tobacco. Cartons or other packaging containing more than a single pack or other container as described in this subdivision shall not be considered individually packaged.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Minor.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Minor” shall mean any natural person who has not yet reached the age of 18 years.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Retail Establishment.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Retail Establishment” shall mean any place of business where tobacco or tobacco related devices are available for sale to the general public.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Moveable Place of Business.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Moveable Place of Business” shall refer to any form of business operated out of a truck, van, automobile, or other type of vehicle or transportable shelter and not a fixed address store front or other permanent type of structure authorized for sales transactions.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Sale.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>A “sale” shall mean any transfer of goods for money, trade, barter, or other consideration.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Compliance Checks.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>“Compliance Checks” shall mean the system the county uses to investigate and ensure that those authorized to sell tobacco and tobacco related devices are following and complying with the requirements of State law to prohibit youth access through this ordinance. Compliance checks shall be conducted in accordance with the laws of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>. Compliance checks may also be conducted by other units of government for the purpose of enforcing appropriate Federal, State, or local laws relating to tobacco and tobacco related devices.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>License.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>No person shall sell or offer to sell any tobacco or tobacco related device without first having obtained a license to do so from the county, unless located within a town or a home rule charter or statutory city that has retained licensing authority under <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Statutes <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Application.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>An application for a license to sell tobacco or tobacco related devices shall be made on a form provided by the county. The application shall contain the full name of the applicant, the applicant's residential and business addresses and telephone numbers, the name of the business for which the license is sought and any additional information the county deems necessary. Upon receipt of a completed application, the County Auditor-Treasurer shall forward the application to the County Board for action at its next regularly scheduled Board meeting. If the County Auditor Treasurer determines that an application is incomplete, the application shall be returned to the applicant with notice of the deficiencies.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Action.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The County Board may either approve or deny the license, or it may delay action for such reasonable period of time as necessary to complete any investigation it deems necessary. If the County Board approves the license, the County Auditor-Treasurer shall issue the license to the applicant. If the County Board denies the license, the notice of the denial shall be given to the applicant along with the basis for denial.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Term.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Generally, licenses issued under this ordinance shall be valid for one calendar year from the date of issue beginning January 1st. Licenses may be issued and granted under this ordinance for a fractional year thereof upon their expiration under another licensing authority, or in the case of a new license application. A license issued for a period of less than one calendar year will expire on December 31 of that year.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Revocation or Suspension.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Any license issued under this ordinance may be revoked or suspended as provided in the Violations and Penalties section of this ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Transfers.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>All licenses under this ordinance shall be valid only on the premises for which the license was issued and only for the person to whom the license was issued. No transfer of any license to another location or person shall be valid.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Moveable Place of Business.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>No license shall be issued to a moveable place of business. Only fixed location businesses shall be eligible to be licensed under this ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Display.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>All licenses shall be posted and displayed in plain view of the general public on the licenses premise.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Renewals.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The renewal of a license issued under this section shall be handled in the same manner as the original application. The request for a renewal shall be made at least 30 days but no more than 60 days before the expiration of the current license. The issuance of a license issued under this ordinance shall be considered a privilege and not an absolute right of the applicant and shall not entitle the holder to an automatic renewal of the license.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Fees.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>No license shall be issued under this ordinance until the appropriate license fee is paid in full. The fee for a license under this ordinance shall be established by resolution of the County Board.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Basis for Denial of License.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The following shall be grounds for denying the issuance or renewal of a license under this ordinance. If a license is mistakenly issued or renewed to a person, it shall be revoked upon the discovery that the person was ineligible for the license under this Section.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The applicant is under the age of 18 years.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The applicant has been convicted within the past five years of any violation of a Federal, State or local law, ordinance provision, or other regulation relating to tobacco or tobacco related devices.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The applicant has had a license to sell tobacco or tobacco related devices revoked within the preceding 12 months of the date of application.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>D</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The applicant fails to provide any information required on the application, or provides false or misleading information.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>E</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The applicant is prohibited by Federal, State or other local law, ordinance, or other regulation from holding such a license.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>F</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The applicant is delinquent in the payment of Federal, State, or local taxes.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>G</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The applicant or proposed business location is in violation of any local ordinances.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Prohibited Sales.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>It shall be a violation of this ordinance for any person to sell or offer to sell any tobacco or tobacco related device:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>To any person under the age of eighteen (18) years.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>By means of any type of vending machine, except as may otherwise be provided in this ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>By means of self-service methods whereby the customer does not need to make a verbal or written request to an employee of the licensed premise in order to receive the tobacco or tobacco related device and whereby there is not a physical exchange of the tobacco or tobacco related device between the licensee or the licensee's employee and the customer.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>D</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>No licensee shall offer for sale single packages of cigarettes or smokeless tobacco in open displays which are accessible to the public without the assistance of a store employee. The self-service restrictions described in “C” and “D” of Section 6 shall not apply to retail stores which derive at least 90% of their revenue from tobacco and tobacco related devices and which cannot be entered at any time by persons younger than 18 years of age.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>E</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>By any other means, to any other person, or in any other manner or form prohibited by Federal, State, or other local law, ordinance provision or other regulation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 7.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Vending Machines.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>It shall be unlawful for any person licensed under this ordinance to allow the sale of tobacco or tobacco related devices by the means of a vending machine unless minors are at all times prohibited from entering the licensed establishment.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 8.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Responsibility.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>All licensees under this ordinance shall be responsible for the actions of their employees in regard to the sale of tobacco or tobacco related devices on the licensed premises, and the sale of such an item by an employee shall be considered a sale by the license holder. Nothing in this section shall be construed as prohibiting the county from also subjecting the clerk to whatever penalties are appropriate under this Ordinance, State or Federal law, or other applicable law or regulation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 9.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Compliance Checks and Inspections.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>All licensed premises shall be open to an authorized county official during regular business hours. At least once per year, the county shall conduct compliance checks by engaging, with the written consent of their parents or guardians, minors over the age of fifteen (15) years but less than eighteen (18) years, to enter the licensed premise to attempt to purchase tobacco or tobacco related devices. Minors used for the purpose of compliance checks shall be trained and supervised by designated county personnel. Minors used for compliance checks shall not be guilty of the unlawful purchase or attempted purchase, nor the unlawful possession of tobacco or tobacco related devices when such items are obtained or attempted to be obtained as part of the compliance check. No minor used in compliance checks shall attempt to use a false identification misrepresenting the minor's age, and all minors lawfully engaged in a compliance check shall answer all questions about the minor's age asked by the licensee or his or her employee and shall produce any identification, if any exists, for which he or she is asked.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 10.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Other Illegal Acts.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Unless otherwise provided, the following acts shall be a violation of this ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Illegal Sales.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>It shall be a violation of this ordinance for any person to sell or otherwise provide any tobacco or tobacco related device to any minor.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Illegal Possession.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>It shall be a violation of this ordinance for any minor to have in his or her possession any tobacco, or tobacco related device. This subdivision shall not apply to minors lawfully involved in a compliance check.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Illegal Use.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>It shall be a violation of this ordinance for any minor to smoke, chew, sniff, or otherwise use any tobacco or tobacco related device.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Illegal Procurement.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>It shall be a violation of this ordinance for any minor to purchase or attempt to purchase or otherwise obtain any tobacco or tobacco related device, and it shall be a violation of this ordinance for any person to purchase or otherwise obtain such items on behalf of a minor. It shall further be a violation for any person to coerce or attempt to coerce a minor to illegally purchase or otherwise obtain for use any tobacco or tobacco related device. This subdivision shall not apply to minors lawfully involved in a compliance check.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Use of False Identification.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>It shall be a violation of this ordinance for any minor to attempt to disguise his or her true age by the use of a false form of identification, whether the identification is that of another person or one on which the age of the person has been modified or tampered with to represent an age older than the actual age of the person.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 11.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Violations.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Notice.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Upon discovery of a suspected violation, the alleged violator shall be issued, either personally or by mail, a citation that sets forth the alleged violation and which shall inform the alleged violator of his or her right to be heard on the accusation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Hearings.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>If a person accused of violating this ordinance so requests, a hearing shall be scheduled, the time and place of which shall be published and provided to the accused violator.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Hearing Officer.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>The County Administrator shall serve as the hearing officer.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Decision.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>If the hearing officer determines that a violation of this ordinance did occur, that decision, along with the hearing officer's reasons for finding a violation and the penalty to be imposed under Section 13 of this ordinance, shall be recorded in writing, a copy of which shall be provided to the accused violator. Likewise, if the hearing officer finds that no violation occurred or finds grounds for not imposing any penalty, such findings shall be recorded and a copy provided to the acquitted accused violator.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Appeals.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Appeals of any decision made by the hearing officer shall be filed in the district court for the jurisdiction of the county in which the alleged violation occurred.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Continued Violation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Each violation, and every day in which a violation occurs or continues, shall constitute a separate offense.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 12.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Administrative Penalties.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Licensees.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Any licensee found to have violated this ordinance, or whose employees shall have violated this ordinance, shall be charged an administrative fine of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for a first violation of this ordinance; $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for a second offense at the same licensed premises within a 24 month period; and $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for a third or subsequent offense at the same location within a 24 month period. In addition, after the third offense, the license shall be suspended for not less than seven days.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Other Individuals.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Other individuals, other than minors regulated by subd. 3 of this Subsection, found to be in violation of this ordinance shall be charged an administrative fee of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of fee__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Minors.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Minors found in unlawful possession of, or who unlawfully purchase or attempt to purchase tobacco or tobacco related devices, shall be required to complete tobacco related education classes, diversion programs, community services or other penalty.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 13.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Criminal Penalties.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Nothing in this ordinance shall prohibit the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> or <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> from seeking prosecution as a misdemeanor offense for any alleged violation of this ordinance, punishable according to the laws of the State of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 14.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Exceptions and Defenses.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Nothing in this ordinance shall prevent the providing of tobacco or tobacco related devices to a minor as part of a lawfully recognized religious, spiritual, or cultural ceremony. It shall be an affirmative defense to the violation of this ordinance for a person to have reasonably relied on proof of age as described by State law.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 15.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>Severability and Savings Clause.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>If any section or portion of this ordinance shall be found unconstitutional or otherwise invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, that finding shall not serve as an invalidation or effect the validity and enforceability of any other section or provision of this ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 16.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">

</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|66|40:49">
<form.text>This ordinance shall take effect <inline.instr>__lsqb__date of effectivity__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>

</form.para>
