<section.body>
<form uuid="I440866d02f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Findings.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Purpose.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Definitions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Prohibition in certain public places.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Regulation of smoking in the workplace.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Posting of signs.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>7.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Compliance and responsibility.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>8.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Where smoking not regulated.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>9.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Severability.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>10.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Penalty.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>WHEREAS, The City Council finds that:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Numerous studies have found that tobacco is a major contributor to indoor air pollution; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Reliable studies have shown that breathing secondhand smoke is a significant health hazard for several population groups, including elderly people, individuals with cardiovascular disease, and individuals with impaired respiratory function, including asthmatics and those with obstructive airway disease; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Health hazards induced by breathing second-hand smoke include lung cancer, respiratory infection, decreased exercise tolerance, decreased respiratory function, bronchoconstriction, and bronchospasm; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Nonsmokers who suffer allergies, respiratory disease and other ill-effects of breathing secondhand smoke may experience a loss of job productivity or may be forced to take periodic sick leave because of such adverse reactions; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Numerous studies have shown that a majority of both nonsmokers and smokers desire to have restrictions on smoking in public places and places of employment; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(f)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Smoking is a potential cause of fires, and cigarette and cigar burns and ash stains on merchandise and fixtures cause loss to businesses; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(g)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>The purposes of this ordinance are:(1) to protect the public health and welfare by prohibiting smoking in enclosed public places open to the general public and by regulating smoking in places of employment; and (2) to strike a reasonable balance between the needs of persons who smoke and the need of nonsmokers to breathe smoke-free air, and to recognize that, where these needs conflict, the need to breath smoke-free air shall have priority.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>NOW THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED by the City Council of the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> as follows:</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>FINDINGS. The City Council hereby finds that the facts stated in the preamble to this Ordinance are true.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>PURPOSE. Because smoking of tobacco or any other weed or plant is a positive danger to health and a cause of material discomfort and a health hazard to those who are present in confined places, and in order to serve public health, safety and welfare, the declared purpose of this Ordinance is to protect public health and safety by prohibiting the smoking of tobacco or any other weed or plant in certain areas which are used by or open to the public.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>DEFINITIONS. For the purpose of this Ordinance, the following terms shall have the following meanings unless the context clearly indicates that a different meaning is intended:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“Bar” means an area which is devoted to the serving of alcoholic beverages for consumption by guests on the premises and in which any serving of food is incidental to the consumption of such beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“City” means the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“Employee” means any individual who receives remuneration for services performed within the city.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“Employer” means any person, partnership or corporation who employs the services of an individual person or persons.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“Smoke” or “smoking” includes the carrying of a pipe, cigar or cigarette of any kind which is burning, or the igniting of a pipe, cigar or cigarette of any kind which is burning.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“Service line” means an indoor line or area where persons await service of any kind, regardless of whether or not such service involves exchange of money. Such service shall include, but is not limited to, sales, giving of information, directions or advice, and transfers of money or goods.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“Restaurant” means any coffee shop, cafeteria, luncheonette, tavern, cocktail lounge, sandwich stand, soda fountain, private and public school cafeteria or eating establishment, and any other eating establishment; organization, club, including veterans club, boardinghouse or guesthouse, which gives or offers for sale food to the public, guests, patrons or employees as well as kitchens in which food is prepared on the premises for serving elsewhere, including catering facilities.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“Retail Tobacco Store” means a retail store utilized primarily for the sale of tobacco products and accessories and in which the sale of other products is merely incidental.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>“Workplace” means any interior space under the control of a public or private employer which employees normally frequent during the course of employment, including, but not limited to, work areas, employee lounges, conference rooms, and employee cafeterias. A private residence is not a workplace under this Ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>PROHIBITION IN CERTAIN PUBLIC PLACES. Smoking shall be prohibited in the following places:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Elevators, museums, libraries, galleries, public transportation facilities open to the public and service lines of establishments doing business with the general public;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Waiting rooms, sleeping rooms or public hallways of every private or public health care facility, including, but not limited to hospitals, clinics, physical therapy facilities, doctors' offices, and dentists' offices; provided further, that this prohibition shall not prevent the establishment of a separate waiting room in which smoking is permitted, as long as there also exists a waiting room in the same facility in which smoking is prohibited. In bed, space areas of health facilities used for two or more patients smoking shall be prohibited unless all patients within the room are smokers and request in writing upon the health care facility's admission forms to be placed in a room where smoking is permitted;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>All buildings, vehicles, or other enclosed areas occupied by city staff, owned or leased by the city or otherwise operated by the city, except in areas which the city administrator may designate as smoking areas. The city administrator may designate such smoking area only if the area involved:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Is not regularly open to the public; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Does not require major room or building modifications; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Is not regularly occupied by nonsmokers.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>In any dispute arising under the smoking area designations made by the city administrator under this Ordinance, the rights of the nonsmoker shall be given precedence.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>D</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Within any building not open to the sky which is primarily used for or designated for the purpose of exhibiting any motion picture, storage drama, lecture, musical recital or other similar performance whenever open to the public, except smoking which is a part of a stage performance, including all restrooms, and any area commonly referred to as a lobby;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>E</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Within all public areas in every retail store and retail service establishment and retail food production and marketing establishment;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>F</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>All restrooms open for public use;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>G</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Within every restaurant and bar;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>H</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>All areas in a laundromat open to and available for use by the public;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>I</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Within all areas available to and customarily used by the general public; in all business, professions and nonprofit entities patronized by the public;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>J</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Lobbies, meeting rooms and hallways and other areas open to the public in hotels and motels; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>K</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance, any owner, operator, manager or other person who controls any establishment or facility described in this Ordinance may declare that entire establishment or facility as a nonsmoking establishment. In such case no smoking shall be permitted anywhere in the establishment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>REGULATION OF SMOKING IN THE WORKPLACE. Each employer who operates a workplace in the City shall, within 60 days of the effective date of this ordinance, adopt, implement and maintain a written smoking policy which shall contain, at a minimum, the following provisions and requirements:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Any nonsmoking employee may object to his or her employer about smoke in his or her workplace. Using already available means of ventilation or separation or partition of office space, the employer shall attempt to reach a reasonable accommodation, insofar as possible, between the preferences of nonsmoking employees and smoking employees. However, an employer is not required by this Ordinance to make any expenditures or structural changes to accommodate the preferences of nonsmoking or smoking employees.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>If an accommodation which is satisfactory to all affected nonsmoking employees cannot be reached in any given workplace, the preferences of nonsmoking employees shall prevail and the employer shall prohibit smoking in that workplace. Where the employer prohibits smoking in a workplace, the area in which smoking is prohibited shall be clearly marked with signs.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>The smoking policy required by this Ordinance shall be announced within three weeks of adoption to all employees working in workplaces in the City and posted conspicuously in all workplaces in the City under the employer's jurisdiction.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>D</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>This Ordinance is not intended to regulate smoking in the following places and under the following conditions within the City:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>A private home which may serve as a workplace; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Any property owned or leased by a state or federal governmental agency.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>E</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance, every employer shall have the right to designate any place of employment, or any portion thereof, as a nonsmoking area.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>POSTING OF SIGNS. Signs which designate smoking or no smoking areas established by this Ordinance shall be conspicuously posted in every room, building or other place so covered by this Ordinance. The manner of such posting shall be at the discretion of the owner, operator, manager or other person having control of such room, building or other place, provided that such signs must be clear and conspicuous.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 7.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>COMPLIANCE AND RESPONSIBILITY.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>A</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>The City <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> or a designated representative shall be responsible for compliance with this Ordinance as to facilities which are owned, operated or leased by the City. The City Clerk shall provide each business license applicant with a copy of this Ordinance, provided that failure to do so shall not affect the responsibility of such applicant to comply with the provisions of this Ordinance.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>B</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>The owner, operator or manager of any facility, business or agency within the purview of this Ordinance shall comply with the provisions of this Ordinance. Such owner, operator or manager shall post or cause to be posted all no smoking signs required by this Ordinance and shall not allow service to any person while such person is smoking in a no smoking area.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>C</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Any place of employment conducted or operated without compliance with the provisions of this Ordinance applicable thereto shall be and the same is declared to be a public nuisance. The City <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> or a designee shall enforce this Ordinance by either of the following actions:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Serving notice requiring the correction of any violation; or</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Requesting the City Attorney to maintain an action for injunction to enforce the provisions of this Ordinance, to cause the correction of any such violation, and for assessment and recovery of a civil penalty of such violation, including attorney's fees.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 8.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>WHERE SMOKING NOT REGULATED. Notwithstanding any provision of this Ordinance to the contrary, the following areas shall not be subject to the smoking restrictions of this Ordinance:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Private residences, except when used as a child care or health care facility.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Hotel and motel rooms rented to guests.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Retail tobacco stores.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>A private enclosed office workplace occupied exclusively by smokers, even though such an office workplace may be visited by nonsmokers.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Any area exterior to the building in which the establishment or facility is located.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>Any enclosed rooms in an establishment or facility which are being used entirely for private functions.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 9.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>SEVERABILITY. If any provision, clause, sentence or paragraph of this Ordinance or the application thereof to any person or circumstances shall be held invalid, such invalidity shall not affect the other provisions of this Ordinance which can be given effect without the invalid provision or application, and to this end the provisions of this Ordinance are declared to be severable.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 10.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">
<form.text>PENALTY. In addition to any other penalty provided, any person, firm or corporation convicted of violating any provision of this Ordinance shall be fined not less than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of minimum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> nor more than $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of maximum fine__rsqb__</inline.instr> for each offense, and a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|56|40:41">

</para.text>
</para>

</para.text>

<section.body>
<form uuid="I440cd3a02f4f11e3947f0000837bc6dd">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>SMOKING REGULATIONS AND HEALTHIER SMOKEFREE ENVIRONMENTS
<field>tbl.ident="I082AEB"</field><field>tbl.uuid="I04961P"</field><field>tbl.position="l"</field><field>tbl.table.width="100"</field><field>tbl.orient="port"</field><field>tbl.date.updated="0"</field>
<field>table.tabstyle="text"</field></form.text>
</form.para>
<tbl>
<table>
<tgroup align="left" cols="2">
<colspec colname="1" colnum="1" colwidth="3*"/>
<colspec colname="2" colnum="2" colwidth="7*"/>
<thead>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">SECTION:</entry></row>
</thead>
<tbody>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">&emsp;</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Preamble</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">&emsp;</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 1</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Purpose</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 2</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Definitions</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 3</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Regulation of Smoking, City Property</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 4</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Regulation of Smoking in Public Places</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 5</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Regulation of Smoking in Places of Employment</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 6</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Where Smoking is Allowed</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 7</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Sign Posting</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 8</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Bars and Restaurants</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 9</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Hardship Situations</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 10</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Chapter not to Excuse Noncompliance with Other Measures</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 11</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Enforcement</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 12</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">Nonretaliation</entry></row>
<row><entry style="block" resize="same">Section 13</entry><entry style="block" resize="same">City Manager Implementation Decisions</entry></row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
</table>
</tbl>
<form.para>
<form.text>PREAMBLE:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>WHEREAS scientific and medical research is reported from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), the U.S. Surgeon General and other researchers, fully documenting the health risks and health effects of both active and passive smoking; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>WHEREAS smoking is the most prevalent and preventable cause of death in the U.S.A., leading to more than twice as many deaths as the other leading causes combined (including alcohol, illegal drugs, motor vehicles, murders, suicide, AIDS, fires, firearms, etc.); and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>WHEREAS the EPA has determined that “widespread exposure to environmental tobacco smoke (ETS) in the United States presents a serious and substantial public health impact” and that ETS contains many harmful chemicals and carcinogens and is a serious health risk to human beings, especially to infants, children, and pregnant women; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>WHEREAS in children, in the U.S.A., ETS exposure is causally associated with hundreds of thousands of respiratory infections and up to a million cases of increased severity of asthma, as well as being a serious risk factor for new cases of asthma in children.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 1 PURPOSE:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Since the active smoking of tobacco and the inhalation of environmental tobacco smoke (ETS) are dangers to human health and the most prevalent cause of preventable death, disease, and disability, as well as are annoyances, inconveniences, discomforts, and general health hazards to those who are involuntarily exposed to such, and in order to serve the public health, safety, and welfare, the declared purpose of this Chapter is to protect people from dangerous, unnecessary, and/or involuntary health risks by prohibiting the smoking of tobacco or any other plant in City or public places and places of employment, as defined in this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 2 DEFINITIONS:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>ACCESSORY BAR: A place within a restaurant for the incidental service of alcoholic beverages and associated snacks, appetizers, and other products for on-site consumption. For purposes of this paragraph, “incidental” means that the gross annual receipts, for every consecutive 12-month period, from the sale of alcoholic beverages, associated snacks, appetizers, and other products for consumption at the accessory bar are no greater than twenty-five percent (25%) of the gross annual receipts of the entire restaurant, for the same period of time.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>BAR: Those business premises where the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Liquor Licenses and Control has licensed the retail sale and on-site consumption of alcoholic beverages, and fifty percent (50%) or more of the business' gross annual revenues, for every consecutive 12-month period, are derived from the sale of alcoholic beverages.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>DESIGNATED SMOKING AREA: Means:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>An indoor area where smoking is allowed under this Chapter that is physically separated and independently ventilated from smokefree areas, so that air within designated smoking areas allowed under this Chapter does not drift or get vented into any smokefree areas. The Superintendent of Building Inspections is authorized to make reasonable requirements, consistent with the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Building Code and this Chapter, applying the terms “physically separated” and “independently ventilated” to accomplish this goal. However, under no circumstances shall the designated smoking area exceed in size the smokefree area in that facility. Moreover, the smoking area shall not include the entry lobby, waiting areas, rest rooms, or areas where minors may customarily congregate in that facility. The designated smoking area shall be constructed so that nonsmoking customers can receive all services provided by that business without walking through the smoking area and without exposure to tobacco smoke.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A designated smoking area may also include the grounds of a building or other facility required to be smokefree under this Chapter when the designated outdoor smoking area is at least fifteen feet (15') away from nonsmoking patrons and the public entrances and exits of the facility.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>EMPLOYEE: Any person who is employed by any “employer” for direct or indirect monetary wages or profits.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>EMPLOYER: Any person or entity employing the service of an “employee.”</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT: Any area under control of a private or public employer that is used as a workplace for employees.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>PUBLIC PLACE: Any area available to, and customarily used by, the public, including areas closed in by a roof and walls with openings for ingress and egress, and any areas used for public gatherings where persons are seated, standing, or otherwise there for a common purpose such as attendance at or waiting lines for events in a park, amphitheater, stadium, or other assembly area so designated or allowed by the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> for a legal event. Public places regulated by this Chapter shall include, but not be limited to: grocery and other retail stores, waiting rooms, public and private schools, doctors' office buildings, pharmacies, hospitals and nursing homes, community centers, child care centers, any group meeting places for children's clubs, scout troops, or other child-/youth-centered organizations, public rest rooms, lobby and public service areas of hotels, motels, sports/recreational facilities, restaurants, and all public places regulated by <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Revised Statutes &sect;<inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>. A public place shall also include all places identified under <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr> or federal law as a place of public accommodation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>RESTAURANT: A facility regularly open for the primary purpose of serving food prepared for consumption, either on or off the premises, to customers for compensation, including those that also serve alcoholic beverages from an accessory bar. For purposes of this Chapter only, a “restaurant” shall have annual gross revenue from the sale of food exceeding fifty percent (50%) for every consecutive 12-month period, excluding, however, food such as appetizers, snacks, and other food products consumed in an accessory bar which the owner chooses to designate as a smoking area under this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>SMOKE OR SMOKING: Means and includes:</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Carrying or placing of a lighted cigarette, lighted cigar, or lighted pipe or any other lighted smoking equipment in one's mouth for the purpose of inhaling and exhaling smoke or blowing smoke rings;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Placing of a lighted cigarette, cigar, or pipe or any other lighted smoking equipment in an ashtray or other receptacle and allowing smoke to diffuse in the air; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Carrying or placing of a lighted cigarette, cigar, or pipe or any other lighted smoking equipment in one's hands or any appendage or devices and allowing smoke to diffuse in the air.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>SMOKEFREE: No tobacco or other plant smoke and freedom from inhaling environmental tobacco smoke (ETS) or passive smoke, including secondhand smoke generated by an active smoker or sidestream smoke or fumes from any such burning material, device, or ashtray that continues to emit such tobacco smoke or fumes from lighted or extinguished smoking materials.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>SUPERINTENDENT OF BUILDING INSPECTIONS: The public officer appointed to that position by the City Manager, or such other person as the City Manager shall designate.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>TOBACCO SHOP: Means:</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>An exclusively retail business,</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>That is not part of a larger store, and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>That derives at least ninety percent (90%) of its gross annual revenue, for every consecutive 12-month period, from the retail sale of tobacco products and smoking equipment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 3 REGULATION OF SMOKING, CITY PROPERTY:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>All buildings and vehicles owned, leased, or occupied by the City of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall be subject to the provisions of this Chapter, as well as outdoor areas or facilities, the primary intended use of which requires persons to assemble, such as group seating or standing or waiting in lines, thus exposing them to inhalation of ETS, excepting designated smoking areas as per Section 5(A)3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 4 REGULATION OF SMOKING IN PUBLIC PLACES:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>No person shall smoke in any public place when the public gathers together for any purpose or event, except in a bar whose owner chooses to allow smoking, in a designated smoking area meeting all the requirements of this Chapter, or pursuant to a hardship exception or phase-in as prescribed in this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 5 REGULATION OF SMOKING IN PLACES OF EMPLOYMENT:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>On or before <inline.instr>__lsqb__due date of adoption__rsqb__</inline.instr>, each employer in each place of employment within the City shall adopt, implement, maintain, and announce to its employees a smoking policy containing at a minimum the following requirements:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Except as set forth below, all workplace areas shall be “smokefree” as previously defined in Section 2.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Smoking is prohibited in conference rooms, meeting rooms, classrooms, auditoriums, cafeterias, kitchens, lunchrooms, employees' lounges, rest rooms provided by employers for employee use, and in waiting areas, including outdoor waiting lines, hallways, stairways, elevators, and areas common to all employees.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A separate smoking area outdoors which does not require others to walk through it upon entering or a smoking area indoors which is separately constructed and negatively pressure ventilated using a separate cooling and/or heating ventilation system may be provided at the option of the employer. However, if an employee complains to the employer or the City that smoke is drifting or being vented out of the designated smoking area and interfering with nonsmokers, and the employer or the City confirm that as a fact, the employer shall repair, relocate, or eliminate the designated smoking area.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Nothing in this Chapter shall require an employer to construct, purchase, or otherwise provide or facilitate any smoking area, and nothing in this Chapter shall preclude the designation of the total premises as smokefree at the option of the employer.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>No employee shall be retaliated against in any fashion, nor subject to termination or to disciplinary action as a result of his complaint about smoking violations in the workplace.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 6 WHERE SMOKING IS ALLOWED:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A private residence or public housing dwelling unit, but the common areas and common open space, as defined in Title <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of title__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> City Code, of public housing projects and private multiple- and single-residence developments that are accessible to the public or the residents of the project or development (such as lobbies, playgrounds or “tot lots,” elevators, and recreation areas, whether located indoors or outdoors) are required to be smokefree when the public or residents gather in those areas, as are private residences required to be smokefree when used as commercial child care or health care facilities.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Hotel and motel rooms rented to guests which may include rooms specified as permitting smoking within rooms so designated.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Private clubs, including fraternal lodges, meeting the definition of private clubs rather than places of public accommodation under the 1964 Civil Rights Act, as amended, conducting private functions where the public is not invited, welcomed, or served, hence not charged for services, will be expected to set their own policies relative to smoking control within their private facilities. Private clubs do not include establishments holding public liquor licenses from the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr> Department of Liquor Licenses and Control, or clubs formed to circumvent this Chapter where persons pay nominal dues or the “members” do not control the operation of the “club.”</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(D)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Where smoking or smoking materials are being used to exercise protected First Amendment activity, such as smoking materials used for bona fide religious purposes.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(E)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Tobacco shops. However, if a tobacco shop shares a common ventilation system with an area required to be smokefree under this Chapter, the tobacco shop must meet the requirements of a designated smoking area before smoking can occur there.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(F)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Hotel, motel, wedding chapel, reception center, restaurant, and any other bona fide conference or meeting rooms while these are being used exclusively for, or leased exclusively for, private meeting functions to which the public is not invited or allowed to attend. However, if a conference or meeting room shares a common ventilation system with an area required to be smokefree under this Chapter, the conference or meeting room where smoking is allowed must meet the requirements of a designated smoking area before smoking can occur there.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(G)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>In a designated smoking area meeting the requirements of this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(H)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>In a building or facility operating under a hardship exception or phase-in, as allowed pursuant to an order of the Superintendent of Building Inspections under this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(I)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>In any building, facility, or area not required to be smokefree under this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 7 SIGN POSTING:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>“No Smoking” signs, “Smokefree” signs, “This is a Nonsmoking Establishment” sign, or the international “No Smoking” symbol shall be clearly and conspicuously posted by the owner/operator/manager/employer or other person in control in enclosed areas where smoking is prohibited by this Chapter, including each entry point. The owner, manager, operator, or other person having control of a business or facility shall remove all ashtrays and other smoking paraphernalia from all areas required to be smokefree under this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Where smoking is permitted indoors under this Chapter, the owner shall conspicuously post a sign stating “Designated Smoking Area” at all entrances to that area. All bars that choose to allow smoking throughout their facility shall post a sign on all outside entry doors stating “This is a Smoking Establishment, and Does Not Provide a Nonsmoking Area.” All signs designating smoking areas or smoking establishments under this Chapter shall also state that “Minors May Not Enter Unless Accompanied and Supervised by a Parent or Legal Guardian.” It is unlawful for an owner, manager, operator, or other person in control of a business or facility to allow minors to enter any area where smoking is permitted under this Chapter unless each minor is accompanied and supervised by a parent or legal guardian.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>If a building or facility has both smokefree areas and a designated smoking area, the owner, manager, operator, or other person in control of that building shall conspicuously post a sign at all initial entry points clearly indicating that “This Establishment Provides Both Smoking and Nonsmoking Areas.” The owner, manager, operator, or other person in control of such a building or facility shall also clearly indicate inside the building or facility, through the signs required in paragraphs (A) and (B) above, in which areas smoking is permitted and in which areas smoking is prohibited.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(D)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>All signs and symbols required under this Chapter shall have letters or symbols no smaller that three inches (3) in height.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 8 BARS AND RESTAURANTS:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Smoking is allowed throughout all bars and their grounds (other than accessory bars in restaurants) providing it does not affect nonsmoking areas.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>All restaurants shall be smokefree, except the restaurant owner may choose to allow smoking:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>In an accessory bar if it is a designated smoking area meeting all the requirements of this Chapter; or</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>If the restaurant owner applies for, is granted, and complies with a hardship exception or phase-in under this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 9 HARDSHIP SITUATIONS:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Hardship Phase-in. As of the effective date, the owner of an existing business or facility required to be smokefree under this Chapter may apply to the Superintendent of Building Inspections for a phase-in of part or all of the structural, HVAC, signage, and other requirements of this Chapter applicable to designated smoking areas. The Superintendent may grant a phase-in period of up to one (1) year. Hardship applicants shall bear the burden of showing that immediate implementation of the requirements of this Chapter would create an undue financial hardship.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>For purposes of this Section, an “undue financial hardship” means that the owner does not have current funds, or the current ability to borrow and repay funds, necessary and sufficient to remodel the owner's facility to comply with this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A hardship phase-in application shall contain the following:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>An estimate from an appropriately licensed contractor of the costs of complying with this Chapter;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text><inline.instr>__lsqb__Statement of matter__rsqb__</inline.instr> sales tax and other financial statements for the most recent annual period purporting to show an undue financial hardship on the applicant;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A time and task schedule for complying with all requirements of this Chapter should a hardship phase-in be granted;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>d</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A sworn statement explaining how the applicant will protect the health of employees and the public from secondhand and sidestream smoke during a phase-in period;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>e</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A sworn statement that the applicant shall completely fulfill the structural, HVAC, signage, and all other requirements of this Chapter applicable to designated smoking areas in that facility in accordance with its submitted time and task statement and within the hardship phase-in period, if granted; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>f</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A description of all efforts the applicant has made, and which reasonably could be made, to operate the business or facility successfully within a smokefree environment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Hardship Smoking Exception. As of the effective date, the owner of an existing business or facility required to be smokefree under this Chapter but wishing to allow smoking throughout the owner's business or facility may apply to the Superintendent of Building Inspections for a hardship smoking exception allowing smoking in an area or areas otherwise required to be smokefree under this Chapter. Applicants shall bear the burden of showing that operating smokefree in part or all of their premises has created an undue financial hardship.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>For purposes of this Section, evidence of a fifteen percent (15%), or more, reduction in gross revenue over the applicable period of time shall constitute prima facie evidence and a rebuttable presumption of an “undue financial hardship.”</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>An application for a hardship smoking exception shall contain the following:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A description of all efforts the applicant has made, or which reasonably could be made, to operate the business or facility successfully within a smokefree environment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text><inline.instr>__lsqb__Statement of matter__rsqb__</inline.instr> sales tax statements comparing sales receipts for a four-month period of compliance under this Chapter and the same four-month period in the year prior to compliance, or other comparable period acceptable to the Superintendent of Building Inspections.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>A sworn statement that the applicant shall comply with the terms of the Superintendent's hardship exception order, including structural, HVAC, periodic reevaluation of the grounds for a smoking hardship exception, and such other requirements the Superintendent may deem reasonably necessary to protect the health of employees and the public.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Application.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>As of the effective date, if a person owns a business or facility subject to this Chapter and wishes to apply for a hardship smoking phase-in, that person shall apply to the Superintendent of Building Inspections within sixty (60) days of the effective date.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>As of the effective date, if a person owns a business or facility subject to this Chapter and wishes to apply for a hardship smoking exception, that person shall apply to the Superintendent of Building Inspections within one year of the effective date.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>All operations within new businesses or new facilities constructed or remodeled after the effective date shall comply with the provisions of this Chapter, and are not eligible for a hardship exception or phase-in.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>If a person submits a complete application for a hardship phase-in or exception within the time frames set forth above, and works in good faith to fulfill the requirements of this Chapter and the orders of the Superintendent of Building Inspections, the Superintendent may temporarily permit smoking in areas otherwise required to be smokefree under this Chapter until the Superintendent finally grants or denies the application.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>If a person fails to submit a complete application for a hardship phase-in or exception within the time frames set forth above, or fails to fulfill the requirements of this Chapter or the orders of the Superintendent of Building Inspections in processing such application, the business or facility must be smokefree as required under this Chapter, or the owner, manager, tenant, and other person(s) in control of the premises are subject to enforcement action under this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(D)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Investigation and Decision. The Superintendent of Building Inspections, or designee, may hold an administrative hearing to review a hardship application under this Section, and the Superintendent may conduct such other investigation and review as the Superintendent deems necessary. The applicant shall cooperate with the Superintendent's investigation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>The Superintendent of Building Inspections may grant a hardship phase-in or hardship smoking exception subject to such terms and conditions as the Superintendent deems reasonably necessary to protect the health and safety of employees and the nonsmoking public, in light of the “Purpose” section of this Chapter, and the preamble.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>The decision of the Superintendent of Building Inspections granting or denying a hardship application under this Section is subject to appeal as a special action in the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr> Superior Court, to the extent and in the manner provided in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr> Revised Statutes, &sect;<inline.instr>__lsqb__number of section__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(E)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>No Application or Permit Fees. The City shall not assess or collect any application fee or charge for hardship exceptions or phase-ins. Furthermore, if remodeling of existing structures, as of the effective date, is undertaken solely for the purpose of complying with the smokefree requirements of this Chapter, no <inline.instr>__lsqb__statement of matter__rsqb__</inline.instr> building permit fees or other City-imposed charges shall be assessed or collected due to such remodeling.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 10 CHAPTER NOT TO EXCUSE NONCOMPLIANCE WITH OTHER MEASURES:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Nothing in this Chapter excuses noncompliance with any <inline.instr>__lsqb__citation of statute__rsqb__</inline.instr> Code (including the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> Zoning Code), county, state, or federal law (such as Occupational Safety and Health Administration standards), or any rule or regulation adopted pursuant thereto.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 11 ENFORCEMENT:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Against the Smoker. Any person who smokes in an area required to be smokefree under this Chapter shall be subject to citation for a petty offense. For the first petty offense, the fine is one hundred dollars ($100). For the second petty offense, the fine is two hundred dollars ($200). For the third petty offense, the fine is three hundred dollars ($300). For each petty offense thereafter, the violator shall be subject to Class One criminal misdemeanor prosecution in the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of municipal court__rsqb__</inline.instr> as an habitual offender. For each violation as an habitual offender, the defendant is subject to a minimum fine of five hundred dollars ($500), a maximum fine of two thousand five hundred dollars ($2,500), six (6) months in jail, or both such fine and imprisonment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Against the Owner, Manager, and Tenant of a Facility. All owners, managers, operators, tenants, or other persons in control of an establishment or area regulated under this Chapter (“responsible party”) are jointly and individually liable for compliance with this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Upon a determination of reasonable cause that a responsible party has failed to fulfill a requirement of this Chapter or to maintain a smokefree environment where required under this Chapter, the Superintendent of Building Inspections, or designee, may issue and serve upon the responsible party a notice of civil violation stating the nature of the violation. The notice shall be in the form established by the Superintendent of Building Inspections. Service shall be made by mailing a copy thereof to the place of business by certified or registered mail. Service shall be deemed completed when so mailed.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Within ten (10) days of service of said notice, the responsible party shall either pay the fine to the Superintendent of Building Inspections, or designee, or request a hearing on the violation by filing a written request for hearing with the Superintendent. If the responsible party pays the fine, the allegations in the notice shall be deemed admitted, and such person shall be deemed responsible for having committed the offenses described in the notice. If a hearing is requested, the City Manager shall appoint a Hearing Officer.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Failure to respond timely to a notice of violation shall result in a default judgment finding the party responsible for the violations described in the notice and imposing the penalties provided for in this Chapter. Unpaid judgments, whether by default or after hearing, may be recorded as liens against the responsible party's property.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Each instance of noncompliance with this Chapter or each instance of failure to maintain a smokefree environment where required under this Chapter shall constitute a separate civil offense. For the first civil offense, the fine is one hundred dollars ($100). For the second civil offense, the fine is two hundred dollars ($200). For the third civil offense, the fine is three hundred dollars ($300). For each offense thereafter, the violator shall be subject to criminal misdemeanor prosecution in the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of municipal court__rsqb__</inline.instr> as an habitual offender. For each violation as an habitual offender, the defendant is subject to a minimum fine of five hundred dollars ($500), a maximum fine of two thousand five hundred dollars ($2,500), six (6) months in jail, or both such fine and imprisonment.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>If the Hearing Officer or judge determines that a violation of this Chapter has occurred, they shall issue an order imposing a sanction in accordance with the schedule in paragraph 4 above and in addition, shall assess against the responsible party the City's personnel, mailing, and other costs incurred in investigating and hearing the case.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Inspection and Investigation. To the maximum extent allowed by law, the Superintendent of Building Inspections, or designee, is authorized to inspect for compliance with all requirements of this Chapter and the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> City Code, including all technical requirements the Superintendent is authorized to develop under this Chapter and any hardship order the Superintendent may issue under this Chapter. The Superintendent's authority includes, but is not limited to, requiring information from persons subject to the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> City Code and investigating the truth of that information, as necessary to determine compliance with the City Code. Persons regulated under this Chapter shall retain for at least three (3) years all information necessary to validate compliance with this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(D)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Suspension, Revocation of Hardship Exception or Phase-in. A material change in circumstances or failure of any person to comply at all times with all terms and conditions of a hardship exception or phase-in shall be grounds for revocation or suspension of the hardship exception or phase-in that was granted. The Superintendent of Building Inspections is authorized to initiate revocation or suspension proceedings pursuant to the civil hearing procedures in this Section.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 12 NONRETALIATION:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>No person or employer shall discharge, refuse to hire, or in any manner retaliate against any employee, applicant for employment, customer, or other person because such person exercises any right to a smokefree environment afforded by this Chapter.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>Section 13 CITY MANAGER IMPLEMENTATION DECISIONS:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="94c763f0b7ba11efb3499aa8422d3018|57|40:42">
<form.text>Any affected person with questions about the implementation of this Chapter and desiring written guidance indicating how the City will apply this Chapter may write to the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr> City Manager. The City Manager is authorized to provide binding, written direction in response to such requests. Such direction shall be consistent with the purposes of this Chapter, as reflected in Section 1 and the preamble.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
</para>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
